title: sue_storm
body:
Susan Storm, also known as Invisible Woman, is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writer [[Stan Lee]] and artist Jack Kirby, Sue first appeared in [i]The Fantastic Four[/i] #1 (Nov. 1961) and was the first female superhero published by Marvel during the Silver Age of Comic Books. Sue and her [[invisible|invisibility]] powers were inspired by works such as [[Universal Studios|Universal]]'s [i]The Invisible Man[/i].

A founding member of the [[Fantastic Four]], she received her powers after being exposed to high levels of radiation in [[space]]. After their mother, Mary, died in a [[car crash]] and their father, Dr. Franklin Storm, being sent to [[prison]] for accidently killing a person, Sue and her younger brother [[Johnny Storm|Johnny]] went to live with their aunt, who ran a boarding house. There, Sue would meet and fall in love with [[Reed Richards]], who was working on an experimental [[rocket ship]] called Marvel-1. After the government cut its funding, Reed decided to take it to space, along with Sue, Johnny and pilot [[Ben Grimm]]. In space, they were hit by a cosmic storm, exposing each of them to cosmic radiation and it sent them crashing back down to [[Earth (planet)|]]. The experience gave each of them superhuman abilities and they decided to become the Fantastic Four. Sue would later marry Reed and together, they would have two kids, [[Franklin Richards|Franklin]] and [[Valeria Richards|Valeria]].

After being hit by the cosmic radiation, Sue and her friends were mutated, allowing her to turn herself, objects or others [[invisible]], manipulate light and generate psionic [[energy barrier|force field]]s. The Fantastic Four's greatest villain, [[Doctor Doom]] stated that she is the most powerful of the group. Sue has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]] and usually wears a [[two-tone bodysuit|two-tone]] [[blue bodysuit|blue]] and [[black bodysuit]] with the Fantastic Four logo on it.

Sue is portrayed by Jessica Alba in the 2005 film [[Fantastic Four (2005)|]] and it's 2007 sequel, Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer, Kate Mara in the 2015 film [[Fantastic Four (2015)|]] and Vanessa Kirby in the 2025 [[Marvel]] film [[The Fantastic Four: First Steps]]. She has also appeared in various other Marvel-releated media like TV shows and video games, including [[Marvel Future Fight]] and [[Marvel Rivals]].

title: over.on
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It appears in [[Gundam Walpurgis]].

The [b]AGX-11 Over.On[/b] is a powerful experimental [[mobile suit]] designed by [[Paptimus Scirocco]]. It combines elements of a Gundam class MS with an external [[reactive armor]] similar in shape to a white [[The O (mobile_suit)|]] mobile suit.

title: paptimus_scirocco
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. Main antagonist from the [[zeta_gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985. 

[b]Paptimus Scirocco[/b] is a very tall, intelligent, evil, charming and powerful [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] Newtype, who commands the [i]Jupitris[/i] energy ship and designed a plethora of mobile suits. (Just don't give him any [[watermelon bar]]s...).

[spoiler]Scirocco's charm, almost a form of mind control, is enough to turn both [[Reccoa Londe]] and [[Sarah Zabiarov]], who were both on good terms with members of the [[AEUG]] [[Argama]]'s crew, into his undying followers (as well as influencing the actions of [[Yazan Gable]]).[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Regardless, he is mercilessly and brutally killed by a ferocious [[Kamille Bidan]] in the [[Zeta Gundam (mobile_suit)|]], who rams Scirocco's [[mobile suit]] [[The O (mobile_suit)|]], its capabilities amplified by the biosensor, straight into Scirocco's cockpit, crushing him to death.[/spoiler]

Paptimus' character design and personality traits are somewhat similar to those of [[Grand Admiral Thrawn]] from [[Star Wars]].

h4. MS designed by Scirocco
* [[Messala]]
* [[Palace Athene]]
* [[Bolinoak Sammahn]]
* [[the_o_(mobile_suit)|The O]]
* [[Over.On]]
* [[Gabthley]]
* [[Hambrabi]]

title: messala
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]PMX-000 Messala[/b]

An experimental transformable [[mobile_suit|MS]] designed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] Newtype [[Paptimus Scirocco]]. The first of his designs, it was nearly unmatched when it was first deployed thanks to its combination of speed and powerful beam weapons. 

As the [[AEUG]]'s technology managed to catch up with it, he ditched the unit, leaving it to be piloted by his underlings [[Sarah Zabiarov]] [spoiler]and later [[Reccoa Londe]].[/spoiler]

title: shashka
body:
The [b]shashka[/b] is a kind of [[saber (weapon)|sabre]]; a single-edged, single-handed, and guardless [[weapon|backsword]]. The comparatively subtle curve of a shashka blade puts the weapon midway between a typically curved sabre and a straight [[sword]]. Its pommel generally protrudes to the side, causing a hooked hilt shape.
[tn](post #2763050 for example)[/tn]

It is often wielded by Russian or Ukrainian [[cossack]]s.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Slavic clothes]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Shashka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shashka

title: stiletto_(weapon)
body:
A [b]stiletto[/b] is a kind of [[dagger]], optimized to function as a stabbing [[weapon]] exclusively. Generally it has little to no cutting edges, being essentially a long, thin spike with a needle-like point mounted to a handle.

The stiletto originated in late 15th century Italy.  As a result of its abilities to penetrate thick clothing and even mail, and to inflict lethal wounds with comparatively less external bleeding, as well as being easy to conceal, it became the favored weapon of the medieval assassin.

Notably used by [[Yor Briar]].

He also appears in [[Touhou Unreal Mahjong]] as an opponent and playable character.

The boss theme was composed by ZUN himself, who also allowed the creators of Uwabami Breakers to use his MOF engine for producing this game. The game is free of charge and downloadable from their official site.

title: chang'e_(touhou)
body:
Chang'e is an enigmatic character. Little is known about her except that she lived on the Moon and was mistress of the moon rabbits before drinking the Hourai Elixir and becoming immortal, for which crime she was imprisoned for her now-eternal life. Today, the moon rabbits sing in unison when pounding mochi to atone for her sin of drinking the elixir.

It was unknown what happened to her until Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom, when it was revealed that [[Junko (touhou)|]] and [[Hecatia Lapislazuli]] had a grudge towards her and that they intended on invading the Lunar Capital to reach her whilst she is still in prison.

While not yet officially seen, some fans have created unofficial designs for her
 
<https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Chang%27e>

title: 2channel_(/livejupiter/)
body:
A board of [[2channel]], also called NanJ. It was launched in 2004 alongside /livesaturn/, /livevenus/, and /liveuranus/ but was a generally slow board. In 2009, the board got a massive surge in popularity following /livebase/'s mass banning of non-baseball threads. On March 21st 2022, the board suffered a massive attack and most users went to /livegalileo/, leaving /livejupiter/ to become a VTuber board.

h4. Characters

* [[Yakiu No Oniichan]]: the baseball fans following the 2009 migration
* [[Kenma-kun]]: a rabbit statue that became popular
* [[Konishi Ayano]]
* [[Karasawa Takahiro]]: the HaseKara incident
* [[AILE-kun]]: head admin

title: miruna_swiftfable_(saverpengu)
body:
[b]Full Name:[/b] Miruna Swiftfable
[b]Race:[/b] Catperson
[b]Age:[/b] 19
[b]Date of Birth:[/b] 02/15/XX
[b]Pronouns:[/b] She/They
[b]Height/Weight:[/b] 5'5 (167cm), 136lbs (61.6kg)
[b]B/W/H Size:[/b] 32" (83cm)/25"(64cm)/40" (103cm)
[b]Eye Color:[/b] Golden
[b]Hair Color:[/b] Lavender w/ Purple Highlights (Formerly White)
[b]Personality:[/b] Silly
[b]Likes:[/b] Chocolate Taiyaki, Old Romance Movies, The color Blue
[b]Dislikes:[/b] Mean people, Oppression
[b]Occupation:[/b] Bounty Hunter/Monster Hunter
[b]Affiliation:[/b] Mirren
[b]Favorite Food:[/b] Chocolate Taiyaki
[b]Favorite Color:[/b] Light Blue
[b]Hobby:[/b] Watching old romance films


[b]Profile:[/b] 
Miruna comes from a faraway village hidden deep in a luminous forest. Though most of the land is covered in snow, this village houses many trees of different colors, most predominantly of which have golden leaves. Laskarr--chief of the village-- had married Garmoniya and raised Miruna peacefully. That is, until an avalanche befell their village following an attack from an unknown entity coated in darkness. In the present day, Miruna spends their days with Mirren in what was a previously abandoned ski lodge. Eating tasty food, watching exciting movies, and even killing monsters as an occupation. The tradition of the village which Miruna hails from mentions having a spirit animal accompany and protect you wherever you go when you become of proper age. Miruna has always had a spirit animal, but didn't quite understand how it could "protect" her, as it was a small blip of energy compared to what everyone else had. It wasn't until she observed Mirren wielding a sword that she was able to replicate--albeit very poorly-- a weapon that she could use to defend herself. Over time, Miruna has been able to use her spirit animal to transform into various shapes and sizes for various different situations.

title: firecracker_(popsicle)
body: The Firecracker is a tricolor [[popsicle]] resembling a [[skyrocket|firework rocket]], red on the top, then white, then blue on the bottom. It has been a product of the Popsicle company since at least 1989. Strongly associated with the [[Fourth of July]].

title: nian_(mythology)
body:
A Nian is a [[Chinese mythology|mythological Chinese]] beast that lives under the sea or in the mountains. Once each spring, around [[Chinese New Year]], it comes out of hiding to attack people, destroy crops and eat animals and children. People have discovered its fear of loud noises, fire, and the colour red. Many [[Chinese New Year]] traditions, such as [[lion dance]], blowing up [[firecrackers]] and wearing and decorating with red are said to have originated from the legend of the Nian, and the practice of scaring it away.

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nian

title: the_fingers_of_punta_del_este
body:
[b]La Mano de Punta del Este[/b] or simply [b]La Mano[/b] (The Hand) is a concrete sculpture located in Punta del Este, Uruguay, created by Chilean artist Mario Irarrázabal. It depicts a hand emerging from the sand. Four replicas of the sculpture exist in Spain, Chile and Italy.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: La Mano de Punta del Este":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Mano_de_Punta_del_Este

title: tokidoki_bosotto_roshia-go_de_dereru_tonari_no_alya-san
body:
[i]Alya Sometimes Hides Her Feelings in Russian[/i] (Hepburn: Tokidoki Bosotto Roshiago de Dereru Tonari no Ālya-san), abbreviated as [i]Roshidere[/i], is a Japanese light novel series written by SunSunSun and illustrated by [[Momoko (momopoco)|]]. It was originally published online as two short stories on the novel publishing website "Shōsetsuka ni Narō" from May 6 to May 27, 2020, respectively. It was then acquired by Kadokawa Shoten, who have published nine volumes and a short story volume since March 2021 under their Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko imprint.

A manga adaptation by [[tenacitysaho|Saho Tenamachi]] began serialization online on Kodansha's Magazine Pocket website and app in October 2022. An anime adaptation by DogaKobo has started airing on July 3, 2024.

h4. Synopsis
[[Alisa Mikhailovna Kujou]] is a half-Russian, half-Japanese high school student who attends one of Japan's best institutions, Seiren Private Academy. With her unparalleled looks and silky silver hair, she can make anyone turn around if she walks past them. Her elegant persona, alongside intelligence, has made her the idol of her school.

On the other hand, Alisa's benchmate [[Kuze Masachika]] is an unmotivated student who sleeps in classes and always plays gacha games. Unable to be honest, Alisa sometimes expresses her thoughts in Russian so that Masachika won't understand. However, unbeknownst to her, Masachika understands Russian as well at the native level.

h4. Characters
h5. Main
* [[Alisa Mikhailovna Kujou|Alisa Mikhailovna "Alya" Kujou]]
* [[Kuze Masachika]]
h5. Secondary & Supporting

title: nautilus_(animal)
body: A mollusk characterized by involute or more or less convolute shells that are generally smooth, with compressed or depressed whorl sections, straight to sinuous sutures, and a tubular, generally central siphuncle. Having survived relatively unchanged for hundreds of millions of years, nautiluses represent the only living members of the subclass nautiloidea, and are often considered "living fossils".

title: klukai_(reverse_collapse)
body:
A character from the [[Reverse Collapse (series)|]] franchise. Debuting in [[Girls' Frontline]], she is an android imprinted with [[H&K HK416]] [[assault rifle]], and appears in [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]] and [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]].

Her name in the first game was directly based on her imprinted gun, serving as her codename, with Neural Cloud adopting a unique name for her in the form of Clukay, which was rerendered as "Klukai":[https://twitter.com/albert752299507/status/1892248452572033497] for the sequel.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair|grey]], [[aqua hair|aqua]], or [[white hair]], [[green eyes]].

A member of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]] along with [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]], [[UMP9 (girls' frontline)|]] and [[G11 (girls' frontline)|]]. Voiced by [[Nonaka Ai]].

body:
A young person between infancy and puberty.

Use [[petite]] when the character is short and female but displays more developed physical attributes (e.g. wider hips for girls)

Not to be confused with [[aged down]], which is for when a character is portrayed as younger than their usual age.

If the image is [[howto:rate|sexually explicit]] or [[sexually suggestive]], use the [[loli]] or [[shota]] tags as appropriate (which are mutually exclusive with this tag). If you are not sure whether a post should be tagged child or loli/shota, ask in topic #8650.

title: jeanne_d'arc_alter_(fate)
body:
Tag for the dark version of Jeanne d'Arc from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Also called [b]Jalter[/b] for short by fans.

Unlike the other [[alter servant]]s, Jeanne Alter is a separate entity of the original Jeanne d'Arc. She was created by [[Gilles de Rais (caster) (fate)|Gilles de Rais]], who was so obsessed with Jeanne that he used a corrupted [[Holy Grail_(fate)|]] to "revive" her. As a result, she is a polar opposite of Jeanne, as she wished to destroy France rather than protect it, as she blamed the very existence of France as a cause of her "original" death.

She is often depicted as being [[tsundere]] in official and fan works, and being somewhat annoyed (though secretly admiring) that the original Jeanne treats her as a sister.

For her original Ruler variant, see [[Jeanne d'Arc (Fate)]].

For her Santa variant, see [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter Santa Lily (Fate)]].

title: james_earl_jones
body:
James Earl Jones (January 17, 1931 – September 9, 2024) was an American actor. A pioneer for black actors in the entertainment industry, he is known for his extensive and acclaimed roles on stage and screen. He is one of the few performers to achieve the EGOT (Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony).
Jones made his film debut in [[Stanley Kubrick|Stanley Kubrick's]] [[Dr. Strangelove]] (1964). He received a Golden Globe Award nomination for Claudine (1974). Jones gained international fame for his voice role as [[Darth Vader]] in the [[Star Wars]] franchise, beginning with the original 1977 film. Jones's other notable films include The Man (1972), [[Conan the Barbarian]] (1982), and [[The Lion King]] (1994).

title: jewelpet_(series)
body:
Jewelpet is a Japanese media franchise and toy line created in 2008 as a joint venture between [[Sanrio]] and [[Sega Sammy|Sega Sammy Holdings]], produced by the third character designer of [[Hello Kitty]], Yuko Yamaguchi, and illustrated by the character designer of [[Cinnamoroll]], Miyuki Okumura. The franchise was originally launched on January 15, 2008, focusing on animals named after jewels, birthstones and minerals, who can use magic using their eyes.

Due to the success of the franchise, Sanrio and Sega Sammy expanded the Jewelpet franchise overseas. The franchise is currently being licensed by Giochi Preziosi for its European release.

The series official slogan is [i]"Eyes of Jewel that Shine, glittering with Luck and Good Fortune".[/i]

h4. Anime Seasons

* [[Jewelpet]] (2008)
* [[Jewelpet_Twinkle|Jewelpet Twinkle☆]] (2010)
* [[Jewelpet Sunshine]] (2011)
* [[Jewelpet_kira_deco!|Jewelpet Kira☆Deco]] (2012)
* [[Jewelpet Happiness]] (2013)
* [[Lady Jewelpet]] (2014)
* [[Jewelpet Magical Change]] (2015)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jewelpet":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jewelpet]

title: conan_(series)
body:
[b]Conan the Barbarian[/b] is media franchise based on the character created by author [[Robert Ervin Howard]] (January 22, 1906 – June 11, 1936). 

Set on Earth in a fictional era in history called the "Hyborian Age", an era set after the Fall of [[Atlantis]] and before the rise of Ancient Civilizations, the story follows [[Conan the Barbarian]], a tall, strong Cimmerian warrior, whose people are descendants of Atlantis survivors. Many of Conan stories follow his adventures in the Hyborian age where he travel to different lands, battle villains, monsters and sorcerers and rescuing damsels in distress.

The Conan series began in 1932 as a series of stories that were published in the Pulp fiction magazine Weird Tales. After Howard's death in 1936, the Conan books were continued by many different authors who either used notes left by Howard or use their own ideas to expand the world of the Hyborian age. The franchise is currently owned by Conan Properties International but will lose ownership of Conan as it enters the public domain worldwide on January 1st, 2028.

Due to the series popularity, Conan has been adapted many times in comics, cartoons, movies and video games. The most well known adaptations includes:

* Conan the Barbarian comics
Originally published by [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]], it ran from 1970 to 1993 with 275 issues. [[Dark Horse Comics]] would publish their own Conan comics, called [b]Conan[/b] to differentiate itself from Marvel's version, from 2003 to 2018 before Marvel bought back the publishing rights.

* Conan the Barbarian (1982 film)
The first live action adaptation of Conan. Conan (played by [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]]) goes on a quest of revenge as he and his allies stop the evil cult leader, [[Thulsa Doom]] (played by [[James Earl Jones]]). While the movie was based on some Conan stories, it also added original plots by director [[John Milius]] including Nietzschean themes. The movie was a hit and was a star making role for Schwarzenegger. Famous for one line where Conan is asked what is best in life which he replies "[i]To crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and to hear the lamentations of their women[/i]!"

* Conan the Destroyer (1984 film)
A sequel to the original movie, Conan with new and old allies, aid a young Princess to retrieve a mystical artifact. The movie received mixed reviews since it was more lighter and adventurous than the previous movie.

* Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
A reboot film staring [[Jason Momoa]] as Conan where Conan must stop an evil Warlord [[Khalar Zym]] (played by [[Stephen Lang]]) from conquering Hyboria. Despite being more faithful to the books, the movie received negative reviews and failed in the box office.

h4. Characters

* [[Conan the Barbarian]]
* [[Belit (conan)|]]
* [[Valeria (conan)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Red Sonja]]

title: do_androids_dream_of_electric_sheep?
body:
[b]Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?[/b] is a [[science fiction]] novel by [[united_states|American]] writer [[Philip K. Dick]] first published in 1968. The main plot follows [[Rick Deckard]], a bounty hunter of renegade [[android]]s, while the secondary plot follows John Isidore, a man of sub-normal intelligence who befriends some of the androids. 

The novel is set in a post-apocalyptic near future, where the Earth and its populations have been damaged greatly by Nuclear War during World War Terminus. Most types of animals are endangered or extinct due to extreme radiation poisoning from the war. To own an animal is a sign of status, but what is emphasized more is the empathic emotions humans experience towards an animal. 

Deckard is faced with "retiring" six escaped [i]Nexus-6[/i] model androids, the latest and most advanced model. Because of this task, the novel explores the issue of what it is to be human. Unlike humans, the androids possess no empathic sense. In essence, Deckard probes the existence of defining qualities that separate humans from androids. 

The book's plot served as the primary basis for the 1982 sci-fi film [[Blade Runner (1982 movie)|]]. 

Japanese title: アンドロイドは電気羊の夢を見るか?

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Do_Androids_Dream_of_Electric_Sheep%3F

body: A franchise centering around the adventures of [[Marty McFly]] as he travels through time in the fictional California town of Hill Valley using a time machine in the form of a [[DeLorean]]. Popular since the first installment of its film trilogy was released in 1985 and became the year's highest-grossing movie, its cast includes Michael J. title: couple
body:
Two characters who are in a romantic relationship with each other.

Use this tag when two characters are portrayed as a couple, showing romantic affection for each other, or otherwise doing something couple-like. 

Don't use this tag when:

* The characters are canonically a couple, but they aren't doing anything couple-like.
* The characters aren't mutually attracted to each other (for example, one is shying away or rejecting the other).
* One character is only minimally present (for example, they're mostly [[out of frame]]).
* The characters are simply having sex without any romantic expression.

title: holostars_idol_uniform_(1st_act)
body:
The [[official alternate costume|official]] [[idol clothes]] worn by the original 9 [[HOLOSTARS]] members for live events and in certain [[promotional art|promotional artworks]], originally designed by [[Nozaki Tsubata]]. The uniform first debuted at the 1st ACT "JOURNEY to FIND STARS!!" live concert in 2021, and is currently considered the standard outfit for the group's idol activities.

Since [[uproar (holostars)|UPROAR!!]] and [[HOLOSTARS English]] have different uniforms, artists may come up with their own interpretations when depicted the members from those groups in this idol outfit. 

h4. Description 
[tn]See post #5235452[/tn]
It consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[white pants]], an [[asymmetrical clothes|asymmetrical]] [[white jacket]] that has longer hem on the left along with [[notched lapels]], [[sleeve cuffs]] and is [[cross-laced clothes|cross-laced]] in the back, a [[double-breasted]] [[black vest]], a [[yellow sash]], a [[side cape|side]] [[capelet]], [[neck ribbon]], [[award ribbon]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[knee boots]]. The color of the capelet, neck ribbon, award ribbon and accent colors differ to match each talent's theme color. They also have accessories unique to each of them (post #5235525):

* [[Hanasaki Miyabi]]: A [[white headwear|white]] [[mini top hat]] with [[hat ribbon]] and [[hat flower]]. 
* [[Kanade Izuru]]: A blue [[floating earrings|dangle]] [[single earring]]. 
* [[Arurandeisu]]: A pair of [[round eyewear|round]] [[yellow-framed eyewear|gold-framed]] [[glasses]]. 
* [[Rikka_(Holostars)|]]: A [[halo]] and a blue variation of his default earring. 
* [[Astel Leda]]: An [[afro]] as a prank from staffs, though the truth is that he gets a [[official alternate hairstyle|new hairstyle]] instead of an accessory.  
* [[Kishido Temma]]: A [[collar chain (jewelry)|]]. 
* [[Yukoku Roberu]]: An [[ear chain]] and [[ear piercing]]. 
* [[Aragami Oga]]: A [[diamond earrings|diamond-shape]] [[single earring]]. 
* [[Kageyama Shien]]: Two [[ear piercing]]s. 

h4. See also
* [[HOLOSTARS idol uniform (2nd Act)]] - A new idol uniform introduced for the 2nd ACT "GREAT VOYAGE to UNIVERSE!!"
* [[UPROAR (HOLOSTARS) idol uniform]] - The standard idol uniform for [[uproar (holostars)|UPROAR!!]]
* [[HOLOSTARS idol uniform (Movin On)]] - A new idol uniform introduced for the 5th anniversary "Movin' On!" concert
* [[HOLOSTARS English idol uniform]] - The idol uniform for [[HOLOSTARS English]] for the "EVERGLOW: Light Of Elysium" 3D live

title: jimiko
body:
[b]Jimiko[/b] (地味子, lit. "sober" or "quiet girl") is a term used to describe a female character with a plain (not necessarily homely), mousy, or unassuming appearance. Their personalities and demeanors are often similarly reserved, shy, or serious.

They frequently fulfill the niche of female "geek" and "nerd" characters: model students, bookworms, and [[otaku]]. In Japanese high school settings, if they are outgoing enough, they are a popular choice for class rep and the student council.

[[Glasses]], [[messy hair|messy]] or [[unkempt]] hair, [[thick eyebrows]], [[twintails]] or [[twin braids|braids]], [[freckles]] and [[bags under eyes|baggy eyes]] can all often complete the look.

h4. Notable [i]jimiko[/i] characters

title: post-apocalypse
body:
The desolation left behind after a huge war or other major disaster on a global scale. The settings were often used in fictional works of varying genres. Usually involves the theme of "survival of the fittest", a fascination of the bygone civilizations, an attempt to restore the old worlds, as well as a "savior" who protects the weak from the oppressive tyrant.

title: plasma_kirby
body:
An occasional [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] charge up and fire [[electrokinesis|beams of electricity]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[gold headwear|gold]] [[circlet]] with a triangular-shaped [[blue gemstone]], and [[electricity]] constantly shoots out of his head. In older games, his skin would also turn [[green skin|green]].

h4.Icon
!asset #32606536

title: freeze_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby's Adventure]] and [[Kirby: Nightmare in Dream Land|its remake]], as well as [[Kirby's Dream Course]], [[Kirby Air Ride]], and [[Kirby: Canvas Curse]] where [[Kirby]] [[frozen|freezes himself]] in an [[ice|icy]] barrier.

In this form, Kirby wears a [[blue coat|blue]], [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] [[parka]] with the [[hood up]].

h4.Icon
!asset #32606525

title: shinko_windy_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Resident "biting girl" of the series.

Windy is easily excitable and has a tendency to bite other characters when agitated. Her verbal tic is "~nanoda" (like [[common_raccoon_(kemono_friends)|Raccoon]] from [[Kemono Friends]]). She loves playing [[prank]]s (specifically on [[Trainer (Umamusume)|]]s).

Windy's real-life horse counterpart has a nasty habit of biting other horses when racing neck-to-neck near the finish line. This has lost him several races with the horse being "too busy" trying to line up a bite instead of overtaking his opponent. This trait endears him to his fans, oddly.

She is voiced by [[Takada Yuuki]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #3076186: [[Tracen School Uniform]]

title: goth_fashion
body:
A fashion style that is typically dark, sometimes morbid, with elements borrowed from Elizabethan and Victorian fashion. Goth fashion can be recognized by its stark black clothing (or hair or makeup), often contrasted with boldly colored clothing, hair and makeup in shades of deep reds, purples, blues or emerald green, lace, silks, and high heels for either gender. 

On Danbooru, the [[goth fashion]] tag refers to both western and eastern styles of gothic clothing.

title: hishi_akebono_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Resident [[tall female|tall girl]] of the series and American-born returnee. Voiced by [[Matsuzaki Rei]].

Akebono's most salient trait is her massive height at 180 cm (5' 11''). As such she is frequently depicted towering above other characters, both in canon and fanart. Fanart tends to pair her with the some of the shortest characters (e.g. [[Nishino Flower_(umamusume)|]]) to further highlight this [[height difference]]. Her special ability also involves growing into a [[donut]]-giving [[giantess]], playing further into her size.

title: grind_fiction
body:
An aesthetic and genre of media that has an emphasis on youth and stylish expression, combining themes like urban settings, street clothing, graffiti, inline skating, stylized vibes, and futuristic views of the 2000s. Can also be described as Y2K or citypunk.

Examples of media utilizing this aesthetic:

* [[Air Gear]] 
* [[FLCL]]
* [[Gachiakuta]] 
* [[Hi-Fi Rush]]
* [[Jet Set Radio]] 
* [[Bomb Rush Cyberfunk]] 
* [[Subarashiki Kono Sekai]] 
* [[Scott Pilgrim (Series)]] 
* [[Sonic Riders (Series)]] 
* [[Splatoon (Series)]] 
* [[Persona]]

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Visual aesthetic]]

title: mayano_top_gun_(scramble_zone)_(umamusume)
body:
The racing outfit of [[Umamusume]]'s [[Mayano Top Gun (Umamusume)|]]. 

It is aviator-themed and consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] dark [[green jacket|green]] [[bomber jacket]] with multiple [[patch]]es, [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[crop top]], [[brown belt]], [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]], dark [[brown thighhighs]], and [[brown boots]]. Her outfit name is an homage to the Kenny Loggins song "Danger Zone", from her namesake film [[Top Gun]].

* !post #3074660: Draft

title: gachiakuta
body:
Gachiakuta (ガチアクタ) is a Japanese [[Grind Fiction]] shounen manga series written and illustrated by [[Urana Kei]] with additional graffiti design by Hideyoshi Andou. 
It began serialization in Kodansha's Weekly Shōnen Magazine in February 2022. As of August 2025, the series' individual chapters have been collected into sixteen volumes.

title: about:danbooru
body:
This page records key parts of Danbooru history in a timeline format. Currently work in progress, featuring Danbooru-adjacent developments, archived link usage to be examined.

h3. Early Danbooru

h5. 2005-05-17
@albert launched Danbooru.
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/422":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070320185536mp_/http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/422]

h5. 2005-05-24
Danbooru's first update was pushed, database is reset in the meantime;
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/432":[http://web.archive.org/web/20060507181600/http://memo.donmai.us:80/post/view/432]
post #1 was uploaded, and thus is considered Danbooru's birthday.

h6. 2005-10-01
Shimmie went live, inspired by Danbooru (though initially built on Futaba and Ajax more).
"http://shish.is-a-geek.net/projects/shimmie/about.php":[https://web.archive.org/web/20060117055149/http://shish.is-a-geek.net/projects/shimmie/about.php] circa 2006-01-17

h6. by 2006-11-17
Moe.imouto.org went live (earliest instance of Moebooru/yande.re).
"http://imouto.org/blog/2006/11/":[https://web.archive.org/web/20071016112852/http://imouto.org/blog/2006/11/]

h6. 2006-11-18
Albert acknowledges Shimmie, wishing Shish the best of luck.
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/652":[https://web.archive.org/web/20070317033443/http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/652]

h6. 2007-01-19
post #100000 was uploaded.

h5. 2007-03-02
Albert publicly took down Danbooru to work on improvements; subsequently released original source code, spawning many booru-style imageboards to come (whether based on or inspired by the codebase);
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/1107":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070304073155/http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/1107] circa 2007-03-04
"http://danbooru.donmai.us":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070322233209/http://danbooru.donmai.us:80/] circa 2007-03-22
The site would remain available to select users in the form of a private closed beta, through miezaru.donmai.us (forum #3261).

h6. 2007-03-07
Earliest pre-release public appearance of Shimmie 2 was launched.

h5. 2007-XX-XX
Version updates to Danbooru's code continue, with 1.1.0 releasing 2007-03-10, setting up Trac on 2007-03-11, 1.2.0 on 2007-03-15, 1.3.2 on 2007-03-26, 1.4.0 on 2007-03-31, 1.4.1 on 2007-04-02, 1.4.2 on 2007-04-05, and 1.5.0. sometime around 2007-04-25, with some smaller blog posts here and there. 
"http://memo.donmai.us/":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070312155721/http://memo.donmai.us/] circa 2007-03-12
"http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/1119":[http://web.archive.org/web/20071225110247mp_/http://memo.donmai.us/post/view/1119] circa 2007-12-25
"http://memo.donmai.us/?page=3":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070408080946/http://memo.donmai.us/?page=3] circa 2007-04-08
"http://memo.donmai.us/?page=2":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070408080946/http://memo.donmai.us/?page=2] circa 2007-04-08
"http://memo.donmai.us/":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070408080946/http://memo.donmai.us/] circa 2007-04-08

h3. Modern Danbooru

h5. 2007-XX-XX
Danbooru went live once more; miezaru.donmai.us would be used for the invite-only open public testing, while danbooru.donmai.us was used for Q&A, source code and links to 'booru alternatives.
"http://danbooru.donmai.us":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070605204007/http://danbooru.donmai.us:80/] circa 2007-06-05

h6. 2007-04-XX
Rule34.paheal.us went live (Paheal being derived from Filipino Ragnarok Online slang meaning "please heal").

h6. 2007-04-21
Shimmie 2 went properly live.

h6. 2007-05-XX
Gelbooru went live, developing "its own software code":[https://gelbooru.com/index.php?page=about].

h5. 2007-09-06
Registration became available once more (topic #167).

h5. by 2007-10-16
Danbooru.donmai.us once more directed to the front page.
"http://danbooru.donmai.us":[http://web.archive.org/web/20071016094743/http://danbooru.donmai.us:80/] circa 2007-10-16

h5. around 2007-12
Standard users couldn't search for multiple tags anymore (topic #473).

h5. 2009-03-03
Notdanbooru.donmai.us was launched, filtering out explicit and questionable posts; was renamed to Safebooru.donmai.us two days later (topic #4414).

h6. 2010-01-29
Safebooru.org went live.

h6. 2010-11-12
Rule34.xxx went live.

h6. 2011-09-20
post #1000000 was uploaded.

h5. 2012-12-21
Albert announced plans to upgrade Danbooru on 2013-02-16 (topic #8830).

h5. 2013-02-16
Danbooru received its announced upgrade to Danbooru 2, danbooru.donmai.us directed directly to Posts now; relevant thread and forum in general was filled with bug reports and varying opinions on the upgrade.

h6. 2015-05-01
post #2000000 was uploaded.

h5. 2015-07-07
Janitor level was removed (topic #11837).

h5. 2015-10-23
Contributor level was removed.

h6. 2017-05-06
@evazion created the Danbooru Discord server (topic #14030).

h6. 2018-01-27
post #3000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2018-03-21
Uploader names were obscured, replaced with Top Tagger in efforts to curb some bad practices (topic #14857, topic #15088).

h6. 2019-01-30
Top Tagger was hidden (topic #15916).

h6. 2019-11-29
UA College of C&IS researcher Dr. Brian C. Britt published an article entitled [i]Content Curation, Evaluation, and Refinement on a Nonlinearly Directed Imageboard: Lessons From Danbooru[/i] ("doi.org/10.1177/2056305119880020":[https://doi.org/10.1177%2F2056305119880020]), discussing the site in detail, a month after invoking Danbooru in his article [i]The use of nondialogic trolling to disrupt online communication[/i] ("doi.org/10.5210/fm.v24i10.10164":[https://doi.org/10.5210/fm.v24i10.10164]).

h5. 2019-12-06
Albert resigned from his position of Danbooru owner, and declared evazion as his successor (topic #16472).

h4. evazion era

h6. 2020-02-25
Super Voters were removed along with the Curated pool (forum #163413).

h6. 2020-05-13
Danbooru Discord server was sponsored on the main page for a couple of weeks. It jumped from around 100 users to around 4000 in a matter of days.

h6. 2020-06-13
Following discussion, Danbooru's romanization system switched from a strictly Hepburn system to a more permissive one based on the system used by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan for their passports. (forum #168056, topic #17011).

h5. 2020-07-07
[[Paid Reward]]s were banned from Danbooru (topic #17092).
Some rules were rewritten (topic #17091).

h6. 2020-07-14
post #4000000 was uploaded.

h5. 2020-07-15
Uploader names were back (topic #15924, forum #169413).

h6. 2021-05-22
Danbooru's 16th birthday (topic #18552).

h6. 2021-12-23
post #5000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2022-05-07
Danbooru got banned from Stripe, preventing users from upgrading to gold.

h5. 2022-05-22
{{Rating:General}} was introduced. Rating:Safe was renamed {{Rating:Sensitive}}. (topic #21277)
Safebooru.donmai.us would be renamed to "donmai.moe":https://donmai.moe/ by this day (forum #213208)

h6. 2022-06-04
Danbooru launched new upgrade code system, to sell codes for gold membership on Shopify.

h6. 2022-06-29
Danbooru was banned from Shopify. Gold upgrades are disabled once again and remain so long-term.

h6. 2022-09-25
NovelAI "announced":https://twitter.com/novelaiofficial/status/1573844864390791169 on Twitter that they have been using Danbooru to train their artwork AI.

h6. 2022-10-03
A Japanese Twitter user "pointed out":https://twitter.com/fugakura/status/1576820035842023424 that NovelAI has been using Danbooru to train their artwork AI. Some mistakenly interpreted this as outright support on Danbooru's end, and the news got traction. In the following days hundreds of artists asked Danbooru to take down their artworks for various reasons. This led to AI-generated artworks being added to the list of prohibited content (forum #223144).

h5. 2022-10-30
The Contributor user level was back alongside Approver, fully replacing the "unrestricted uploads" and "approve posts" Builder permissions.

h6. 2023-01-20
post #6000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2023-12-19
post #7000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2024-08-14
post #8000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2025-03-15
post #9000000 was uploaded.

h6. 2025-09-21
post #10000000 was uploaded.

h4. See also
* [[Help:Home]]
* topic #18008 - thread where the timeline is discussed

h3. External historical links
* "Moetry":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070304121219/http://memo.donmai.us/], Albert's original blog (2004-02-29 to 2011-01-05)
* "Trac (Danbooru 1)":[http://web.archive.org/web/20070323140301/http://trac.donmai.us/] (2007-03-11 to July-August 2012)
* "Google Code (Danbooru 1)":[https://code.google.com/archive/p/danbooru/] and "Subversion Repo":[https://storage.googleapis.com/google-code-archive-source/v2/code.google.com/danbooru/repo.svndump.gz] ("git version":[https://github.com/danbooru1/danbooru]; latest commit 2010-07-15)
* "Notes From Danbooru":[https://notesfromdanbooru.wordpress.com/], Albert's post-Moetry blog (2011-05-07 to 2012-12-21)

title: dual_persona
body:
Two different versions of the same character appearing together in the same scene. Example: [[Saber (fate)|]] & [[Saber Alter]].

If the picture depicts them as two distinct characters in the same scene, don't use [[solo]], [[1girl]] or [[1boy]] with this tag. Exceptions are [[split theme]], [[multiple views]], [[creature and personification]] and similar themes.

When the character is meeting their [[aged up|older]] or [[aged down|younger]] self, also tag [[age comparison]] if the personas have no interactions, or [[time paradox]] if the personas have interactions other than posing for the camera.

If the instances of the character are identical, use [[clone]] instead. If more than two personae are in one image, use [[multiple persona]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #4407573: [[Sakura Miku]] and regular [[Hatsune Miku|Miku]]

h4. See also

* [[age comparison]]
* [[dark persona]]
* [[doppelganger]]
* [[look-alike]]
* [[selfcest]]
* [[clone harem]]

title: age_comparison
body:
A type of [[dual persona]] where a character is depicted as two different ages (such as a child and an adult, or a young adult and an older adult) in the same image. Often used for comparison's sake, but could be a [[time paradox]] as well if the characters interact with each other in any way.

h4. Examples

* !post #2421999
* !post #6838657

h4. See also

* [[age progression]]
* [[age regression]]

title: x_(mega_man)
body:
The main protagonist of the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series. X also serves as a guide during the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] series as [[Cyber Elf X (mega man)|]] and appears as Biometal [[Model X (mega man)|]] in the [[Mega Man ZX]] series. 

He is the successor of the original [[Mega Man (character)|]] and is [[dr. light (mega man)|Dr. Thomas Light's]] greatest creation. Throughout the X series, X is a Maverick Hunter who fights alongside his partners [[zero (mega man)|Zero]] and [[Axl (mega man)|]] in order to maintain peace and stability in the world and protect humans and Reploids alike from Mavericks, though X would like nothing better than the opportunity to stop fighting. Because of his aversion to violence, X is initially ranked a B-Class Hunter, but he is eventually promoted to S-Class.

title: holostars_idol_uniform_(movin_on)
body:
The [[official alternate costume|official]] [[idol clothes]] worn by the Japanese [[HOLOSTARS]] members for the 5th anniversary live concert "Movin' On!". Also officially known as the "starry outfit."

It consists of a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[two-tone jacket]] with [[notched lapels]], [[sleeve cuffs]], [[gold trim]], a [[shoulder sash]] over a [[black shirt|black]] [[t-shirt]] with the concert [[logo]], a [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]], [[white pants]] with a [[belt]], [[thigh strap]] and [[waist cape]], and [[oxfords]]. The jacket, sash, waist cape and belt are colored to match each talent's theme color.

A black version of the uniform was unveiled in the "New Year's Voice Comic":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9EDgn0Z4200] at the end of 2024.

h4. Appearance
* !post #7432107: White version
* !asset #32605098: Black version

h4. See also
* [[HOLOSTARS idol uniform (1st Act)]]
* [[HOLOSTARS idol uniform (2nd Act)]]

title: mejiro_mcqueen_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Oonishi Saori]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. 

A lady from the prestigious Mejiro family, Mejiro McQueen is the resident [[Ojou-sama]] character of the series. While she strives to be as prim and proper as she can, she has to deal with [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]]'s antics as well as her own sweet tooth.

While she was a supporting character in the first season of the anime, she became the deuteragonist for the second season, sharing the spotlight with [[Tokai Teio (umamusume)|]] and exploring the Mejiro family in more detail. In the mobile game, she is the main character as well as the first member of Team Sirius, after [[Oguri Cap (Umamusume)|]] retired.

title: king_halo_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]] and resident "[[ojou-sama pose|ojou]]" of the series. She acts like a haughty noble, but she is a good person in heart. Often paired with [[Haru Urara (umamusume)|]], who is her roommate, or [[Seiun Sky (Umamusume)|]].

She is infamous for being one of the hardest characters to train in the game due to the wide range of distances she is expected to race on. Thankfully, she is at least competent in all distances (A-B-B-C). She also becomes a member of Team Ascella, supporting [[Rhein Kraft (umamusume)|]] and [[Cesario (umamusume)|]] in their races.

title: el_condor_pasa_(umamusume)
body:

title: dan_heng_(lurking)_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Honkai: Star Rail]]'s [[Dan Heng (Permansor Terrae) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Dan Heng (Permansor Terrae)]], exclusive to the 3.6 Nameless Honor set. 

He is portrayed in a [[black coat]] with a [[white shirt]] over a [[black shirt]] and wearing a [[headset]], along with the Permansor Terrae form's distinctive yellow [[dragon horns]].

body:

She is portrayed with a [[white coat]], [[sunglasses]] worn [[eyewear on head|on her head]], and holding a [[walkie-talkie]].

title: doodle_commander_(azur_lane)
body:
The [[Azur Lane]] [[commander_(azur_lane)|Commander]] depicted as a [[child's drawing]] of a man with a literal [[smiley face]] wearing a [[peaked cap]]. First seen in [[Akashi (Azur Lane)|Akashi]]'s letter to the player for returning to the game after an extended absence, it became a more common depiction of the Commander in fan works following its appearance as the player's 3D avatar in the new 3D Island Planner game mode.

Despite the similarities to [[Blue Archive]]'s [[Doodle Sensei (Blue Archive)|Doodle Sensei]], Doodle Commander actually predates Blue Archive's release by at least 3 years. As with Doodle Sensei, Doodle Commander often appears as a living doodle or a person with a [[paper on head|paper depicting the doodle stuck on their head]].

h4. See also

* [[Commander (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Doodle Sensei (Blue Archive)]]

title: papillon_(dog)
body:
A breed of toy [[dog]] originating from France best known for its small stature, high intelligence, and erect ears with lots of long stringy fur fanning out to resemble a butterfly ([i]papillon[/i] is French for [i]butterfly[/i]).

[[Wonderful Precure!]]'s [[Inukai Komugi (dog)|]] is a Papillon.

title: mafioso_(frozen_soul)
body:
Also known as the Mafia, these are standard enemies present in many of [[Frozen Soul]]'s dreams.
Mostly represented as a tall fedora-wearing man, though they come with a variety of hats and weapons.

Used to be present in [[Forsaken (Roblox)|]] as a skin, until it got redesigned. In that game, it used bunnies as projectiles, which lead to fanart with bunny traits.

title: nakayama_kinni-kun
body:

title: laffey_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of the [i]Benson[/i]-class destroyer USS [i]Laffey[/i] (DD-459). 
Character design by [[Kaede (Yumesaki Kaede)|]], voiced by [[Naganawa Maria]].

She is a petite girl with [[red eyes]] and [[white hair]] tied in fluffy [[twintails]], and posesses a [[hairband]] with [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[rabbit ears]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white camisole]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], or [[thigh boots]], depending on the artist, with [[rudder footwear|rudders attached]], and a [[pink jacket]].

She is often portrayed as [[sleepy]] or tired, or even as [[drunk]] (with her preferred drink being whiskey). This is a reference to the historical [i]Laffey[/i]'s final battle against the Japanese battleship [[Hiei (azur lane)|]] and two other destroyers during the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal, where Laffey nearly collided with Hiei due to the battle taking place at midnight. She would eventually sink after taking direct hits from Hiei's 356 mm guns and a torpedo from destroyer [[Murasame (kancolle)|]].

title: laffey_ii_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [i]Allen M. Sumner[/i]-class USS [i]Laffey[/i] (DD-724). 
Character design by [[Kaede (Yumesaki Kaede)|]], voiced by [[Naganawa Maria]]. 

She is not to be confused with her predecessor [[Laffey (Azur Lane)|]] (DD-459). She has the same body and memories as [[Laffey (Azur Lane)|]], but different equipment and abilities.

She is [[petite]], with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] in [[twintails]] and [[small breasts]]. Her new outfit consists of a [[criss-cross halter]] [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] worn [[off shoulder]], new [[fake animal ears|false]] [[rabbit ears]], [[blue ribbon]]s, and [[white thighhighs]] with [[legwear garter]]s. Her new [[rigging]] is distinctly futuristic in nature, sporting her historical 12.7 cm twin gun mounts and [[holographic monitor]]s plus two [[drone]]s. 

Originally revealed in the trailer for the [i]Parallel Superimposition[/i] event in 2022, she was made playable from December 21, 2023 in the [i]Light-Chasing Sea of Stars[/i] event.

title: lin_(arknights)
body:
[i]The mystery character from Lungmen, helping you amidst the shadows.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lin Yühsia

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Lungmen[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]November 9[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Zalak[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]166 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]7 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Daughter of [[rat king (arknights)|The Rat King]] Lin Kojui and his sole heir to Lungmen's criminal underworld, publicly working as president of Lungmen's Young Entrepreneurs' Association. Was once friends with [[swire (arknights)|Swire]] and [[ch'en (arknights)|Ch'en]] but their friendship has deteriorated to insults and name-calling.

A recurring side character appearing in Chapter 6 and 7 of the main story, side-stories [i]Code of Brawl[/i] and [i]Dossoles Holiday[/i], and finally made playable during the side-story [i]Where Vernal Winds Will Never Blow[/i].

Similar to her father, she possesses the ability to control sand, particularly being able to turn sand into glass, which she then uses in combat and to make sculptures.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Itou Kanae]].

title: greedo
body: Greedo is a [[Star Wars]] character, he is a Rodian bounty hunter from the Tetsu Clan and worked for crime boss Jabba the Hutt. Greedo's Huttese language is based on Quechua, the Inca language. He appears in the first Star Wars film during a scene where he confronts and threatens [[Han Solo]], only to be killed by Solo. The scene was later altered so that Greedo also shoots at Han, leading to the infamous fan controversy known as "Han shot first", which the character has since come to be most associated with.

title: loki_(marvel)
body:
Loki Laufeyson (sometimes Odinson) is the adopted brother of [[Thor (marvel)|]] and is the god of mischief, outcasts, stories, lies, etc. He is portrayed by [[Tom Hiddleston]] in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe.

Though he is a shapeshifter, his usual appearance is that of a thin young man with shoulder-length [[black hair]], green [[leather armor]] made from fine Asgardian leather with gold trimmings, and either a golden [[horned helmet]] or simpler [[horned headwear]].

title: peter_quill
body:
Peter Jason Quill is a leader of Guardians of the Galaxy and a Celestial-Human hybrid who was abducted from Earth in 1988 by the Yondu Ravager Clan, eventually building a reputation as the notorious intergalactic outlaw [[Star-lord]]. He forged an uneasy alliance with fellow inmates [[Gamora]], [[Drax the Destroyer]], [[Rocket Raccoon]], and [[Groot]], who together formed the [[Guardians of the Galaxy]].

[[Chris Pratt]] portrays the character in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

title: angel_martinez

title: nice_nature_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Maeda Kaori]]. 

Nice Nature sees herself as the most normal and sane member of the team but she instead comes off as the most insecure, basically citing the original horse's collection of third places. Personality-wise, she is an unassuming, unambitious, and laidback character, opting not to be overly expressive in most scenarios. Despite her laidback attitude, she takes racing very seriously. Whether she wins or loses, she doesn't let anything go to her head. Although not often, when she does express herself, she tends to get embarrassed rather easily (usually in front of her [[Trainer (umamusume)|]]).

title: dawn_winery
body:
A location from [[Genshin Impact]], it is the chief winery in Mondstadt that specializes in Dandelion [[Wine]].

It has been owned by the Ragnvindr Clan since [[Ragnvindr (genshin impact)|]] for several generations, with the current owner being [[Diluc (genshin impact)|]] who inherited it around 4 years ago after the death of [[Crepus (genshin impact)|]]. Dawn Winery is so successful that it effectively represents the entire wine industry in Mondstadt. It also owns and operates the Angel's Share tavern in [[Mondstadt City]].

Dawn Winery is located in the south-western region of Mondstadt, specifically Windwail Highland and is west of [[Springvale (genshin impact)|]] and south of [[Wolvendom]]. It is comprised of the central two-story manor which is surrounded by the [[vineyard]] and multiple storage [[shed]]s. There is also a small [[lake]] and numerous [[house]]s in the vicinity.

title: haru_urara_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character, voiced by [[Shuto Yukina]]. A very cheerful and friendly [[horse girl]] who never gives up. She is from Kochi, in Shikoku (the original horse's career was entirely spent racing in local races in Kochi).

The real life [[Haru Urara (racehorse)|]] was known not for winning (or even for having the longest losing streak, for that matter), but rather for her persistence in the face of a very long string of consecutive losses (no victories in [b][i]113[/i][/b] races); she was profiled in a 2016 short film, "The Shining Star of Losers Everywhere":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5424802].

title: quality
body:
[tn]This term is properly spelled "QUALITY" (without the quotes), in ALL CAPS. This tag is written in lowercase due to limitations in Danbooru's tagging system.[/tn]

The term "QUALITY" indicates (with ironic intent) glaring yet humorous errors and flaws in commercial works of poor quality or works of otherwise good quality. This can be caused by poor budgeting (blowing most of the budget of an anime into the first episodes, per example), a small budget or outsourcing to cheaper studios, although it can also be as a result of a honest mistake.

The Japanese equivalent is "ヤシガニ" ("Coconut crab"), a reference to [[Lost Universe]]'s 4th episode which, due to the show's notoriously bad animation, was turned into a byword for bad animation in general. A more descriptive term is "作画崩壊" ("Animation collapse").

This tag can be applied to any posts that [i]intentionally[/i] recreates the disfigured art or animation frame for humorous purposes. Do [i]not[/i] apply this tag to any other post with generally poor quality otherwise. For posts featuring an error unintentionally created by an artist, see [[artistic error]].

h4. See also
* [[Anubis-kun]]
* [[cursed M4A1 (meme)]]
* [[Ecce Homo]]
* [[Mobile Suit Gundam: Cucuruz Doan's Island]]
* [[quality cabbage (meme)|]]
* [[running ganger (meme)]]
* [[Sader]]
* [[Takahashi Youichi (style)]]
* [[Chargeman Ken!]]

title: quetzalcoatl_(mythology)
body:
[b]Quetzalcoatl[/b], referred to as [b]K'uk'ulkan[/b] by the [[Maya (culture)|]]ns, is a major deity in the Mayan and [[Aztec]] cultures.

Its name literally means "Feathered Serpent" in the [[Nahuatl]] language.

One of the many ancient representations of this god was a bearded white man. Since the sixteenth century, it has been widely held that the Aztec Emperor [[Moctezuma II]] initially believed the landing of [[Hernan Cortes]] (a bearded white Spaniard man himself) in 1519 to be Quetzalcoatl's return, thus facilitating the subsequent "Conquest of Mexico" and the defeat of his Aztec Empire. 

Some Mormons even believe that Quetzalcoatl was historically [[jesus|Jesus Christ]], who visited America in ancient times.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Quetzalcoatl":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quetzalcoatl]

title: infection_monitor_(arknights)
body:
A device in the setting of [[Arknights]].

An infection monitor's primary use is to detect Oripathy infection in an individual, and if an infection is confirmed, to track the progress of the disease. It also monitors a person's general health and well-being. As such it is used by both the infected and the uninfected, particularly those uninfected who are at high risk.

A variant called a Suppressor has additional functions for infected people that help control [[Originium Arts (arknights)|]] outbursts caused by Oripathy.

Monitors are manufactured by different companies in different styles. The ones sold by Rhodes Island and used by its staff and patients resemble black, solid bands with inlaid X-shaped blue lights. Their exact model and design is tailored to the wearer's needs, in general they take the form of an accessory or piece of jewelry, and are usually worn close to external [[oripathy lesion (arknights)|]]s if those are present.

h4. Examples

* !post #8000128: [[Collar]]

title: granblue_fantasy
body:
[b]Granblue Fantasy[/b] (グランブルーファンタジー [i]Guranburuu Fantajii[/i]), officially abbreviated as [b]Granblue[/b] (グラブル [i]Guraburu[/i]), is a mobile turn-based RPG by [[Cygames]], with a Japanese-only release in March 2014, and an English-language release in April 2016. The official anime released in 2017, followed by a second season in 2019. 

The gameplay is heavily reliant on the player's summons and weapons obtained from the gacha system and from in-game raids. The player can equip a maximum of ten weapons and five summons at a time and this is generally referred to as the "weapon grid" and "summon pool".

Granblue is infamous for its competitive week-long event (Guild Wars/Unite & Fight/古戦場) where players farm chunks of meat and try to score more points than their opponent crew for hours at a time. Art is occasionally drawn depicting this in game event, one example being [[post guild war celebration]]s.

h4. Races

Most characters in Granblue Fantasy are divided into 5 races. 

* Human. Most characters fall into this.
* [[Erune]], whose notable features are their animal ears and clothing that expose their backs.
* [[Harvin]], dwarf sized humanoids.
* [[Draph]], humanoids with prominent horns on their heads. Males are tall and muscular, while females are noticeably shorter than the average person, while having big breasts.
* Primal. Primal beasts are creatures that were crafted by the Astral beings long ago. A good number of them (usually humanoid) end up joining the player's crew for one reason or another. 

h4. Protagonist

The player is represented by either [[Gran_(granblue_fantasy)|]] or [[Djeeta_(granblue_fantasy)|]] based on their gender selection and this can be changed at any time. The player may also change their class at any time which also changes their costume.

h4. Characters

Major story characters include:
* [[lyria (granblue fantasy)|Lyria]] 
* [[vyrn (granblue fantasy)|Vyrn]] 
* [[katalina (granblue fantasy)|Katalina]] 
* [[eugen_(granblue_fantasy)|Eugen]] 
* [[io (granblue fantasy)|Io]] 
* [[rackam (granblue fantasy)|Rackam]] 
* [[rosetta (granblue fantasy)|Rosetta]] 

For a full list of characters including NPCs, see the "English wiki list":[https://gbf.wiki/All_Characters] or the Japanese wiki list (for "Playable Characters":[https://gbf-wiki.com/index.php?%C1%B4%A5%AD%A5%E3%A5%E9%A5%AF%A5%BF%A1%BC%B0%EC%CD%F7] and for "NPC Characters":[https://gbf-wiki.com/index.php?%A5%B9%A5%C8%A1%BC%A5%EA%A1%BC%A5%AD%A5%E3%A5%E9]).

h4. See also

* [[Granblue Fantasy Versus]]
* [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]]
* [[Granblue Fantasy: Relink]]

h4. External links

* "Official Granblue Fantasy Twitter (Japanese)":https://twitter.com/granbluefantasy/
* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki (EN)":https://gbf.wiki/
* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki (JP)":http://gbf-wiki.com/
* "Granblue Fantasy Image Viewer":https://gbf-img.com/
* "Wikipedia: Granblue Fantasy":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Granblue_Fantasy

title: remilia_scarlet
body:
The "Scarlet Devil". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character.

[[vampire|Vampiric]] mistress of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] of at least 500 years of age despite her childish appearance, whose title comes from the bloodstains on her clothes and her fearsome ability to manipulate fate. Nevertheless, she is refined and friendly, if somewhat bratty. Besides her younger sister [[flandre_scarlet|Flandre]] and the rest of her household - head maid and personal attendant [[Izayoi Sakuya]], gatekeeper [[Hong Meiling]], and librarian [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and the little devil [[Koakuma]], among others - she is also good friends with her one-time nemesis, [[Hakurei Reimu]]. Atypical of vampires, Remilia has a low appetite for blood.

Sometimes drawn with her weapon, [[Spear the Gungnir]].

Nicknamed おぜうさま ([i]ozeu-sama[/i]) in Japanese, to differentiate her from countless other [i]ojou-sama[/i] characters.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7476325: Profile

h4. See also

* [[uu~]]
* [[Miserable Fate]]
* [[Charisma Guard]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Remilia Scarlet":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Remilia_Scarlet

title: jinzo_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 6
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Machine/Effect

[i]Trap cards, and their effects on the field, cannot be activated. Negate all Trap effects on the field.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 2400
[b]DEF[/b] 1500

A [[pink skin|pink-skinned]] [[cyborg]] with [[psychic|psychic powers]] and green attire. Bears a resemblance to [[Pinhead]] from [[Hellraiser]]. 

A signature card of [[Jonouchi Katsuya]], after he won it from [[Esper Roba]] during Battle City. Known in Japanese as "Android - Psycho Shocker". 

In fan art, Jinzo is often portrayed as a rival to the Traptrix, Eldlich and Labyrnth archetypes, mostly because of its Anti-Trap card effect.

title: tsukuyomi_sena
body:
Tsukuyomi Sena is a collaborative [[UTAU]] voicebank created by users of the English-speaking anonymous [[imageboard]] [[39chan]]. They are a shapeshifting [[alien]] taking on the form of an [[androgynous]] human. Progress on the voicebank would begin on September 22, 2024 with [[28lane]] providing the initial concept designs (and later final artwork). An user named Lynx would later become Sena's voice provider. The voicebank was finished in February 20, 2025.

Their character item is [[surstromming]].

title: iwo_jima
body:
[b]Iwo Jima[/b] (硫黄島, [i]"Sulfur Island"[/i]) is a [[Japan]]ese volcanic island located south of the Bonin islands. Currently adminstated by the [[Tokyo (city)|]] Metropolitan Government. Now officially known as [b]"Ioto"[/b] in Japan.

Best known as the site of "the 1945 Battle of Iwo Jima":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Iwo_Jima during [[World War II]]. The battle ended in a very costly American [[victory]]. It remains the only battle of the Pacific [[war]] where U.S. casualties (26,571) surpassed those of the Empire of Japan (18,375). 

h4.See also
* [[Raising the Flag on Iwo Jima]]
** [[Mount Suribachi]]
* [[Kuribayashi Tadamichi]]  
* [[Nishi Takeichi]] 
* [[Letters From Iwo Jima]]
* "Flags of Our Fathers":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flags_of_Our_Fathers_(film)
* [[The Pacific]]
* [[tag_group:history]]

title: spain
body:
A country in Western Europe. [b]Spain[/b] (pronounced /ˈspeɪn/ spayn; Spanish: [i]España[/i], pronounced [esˈpaɲa]), officially [b]The Kingdom of Spain[/b] (Spanish: [i]Reino de España[/i]), is a country and member state of the European Union located in southwestern Europe on the Iberian Peninsula. Its capital city is [[Madrid]].

Its mainland is bordered to the south and east by the Mediterranean Sea except for a small land boundary with the British Overseas Territory of Gibraltar; to the north by [[France]], [[Andorra]], and the [[Bay of Biscay]]; and to the northwest and west by the [[Atlantic Ocean]] and [[Portugal]].

Official language: [[spanish_text|Spanish]]

title: patrick_bateman
body:
The main character of the novel [[American Psycho]], played by [[Christian Bale]] in the movie adaptation.

Patrick Bateman is depicted as a wealthy and narcissistic investment banker. He leads a double life as a sadistic serial killer, indulging in extreme violence and exhibiting psychopathic tendencies. 

The character has a strong presence in [[meme]] culture due to his perceived "sigma" personality.

h4. See also

* [[American Psycho]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Patrick Bateman":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Bateman]

title: portugal
body: A country in western Europe bordering [[Spain]]. Its official language is [[portuguese_text|Portuguese]]. Its capital and largest city is Lisbon. The first European nation to trade with [[India]] and [[Thailand]], and introduced [[matchlock ]]/[[Tanegashima (gun)|]] rifles to [[Japan]] in 1543 (Ashikaga Period).

title: carolean
body:
The [[soldier]]s of the Swedish empire under Kings Charles XI & [[charles xii of sweden|XII]], from 1680, after Charles XI instituted an absolute monarchy, until the death of Charles XII in 1718. Their outfits featured [[tricorne]] hats, and were distinctively were blue on top, and yellow on the bottom - the colors of the [[Swedish flag]].

h4. See also

* [[Charles XII of Sweden]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Caroleans":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caroleans]

title: conquistador
body: Conquistadors or conquistadores were the explorer-soldiers of the [[Spain|Spanish]] and [[Portugal|Portuguese Empires]] of the 15th and 16th Centuries. The conquistador appearance is most characterized by the [[morion]], a heavy steel [[helmet]] with a pronounced crest or comb on top and sweeping sides that comes to points on either end.

body:

title: perky_goth
body:
Western alternative fashion trend originating in the 1980s. It combines the darker elements of [[goth fashion]] with vibrant, upbeat elements and focuses on the contrast between the two.

The fashion often consists of black clothing paired with bright and cheerful colors, [[fishnets]], dyed hair, [[boots]], fun patterns, skirts/dresses, and chokers. Makeup usually involves dramatic eyeshadow and/or eyeliner.

h4. See also

* [[tag group:fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Aesthetics Wiki: Perky Goth":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Perky_Goth

title: gelato
body:
A style of soft rich [[ice cream]] that originated from Italy. Unlike American-style ice cream that legally contains up to 50% air, gelato contains between 25-35% air and contains less butterfat typically found in standard ice creams.

h4. See also

* [[Sorbet]]
* [[Sherbet]]

title: carmel_(one_piece)
body: A [spoiler]villainous[/spoiler] character from the manga and anime [[One Piece]]. She was running an orphanage [spoiler]while actually trafficking the poor children to her contacts in the criminal underground[/spoiler]. Carmel was almost certainly [spoiler]accidentally eaten by her intended last victim, [[Charlotte Linlin]], in an eating frenzy on her sixth birthday (that poor girl unwittingly saved herself from the child trafficker, but was lead by [[Streusen]] into a life of piracy)[/spoiler].

title: american_football
body:
A team sport played mainly in the United States and Canada. Two teams attempt to take an oval [[American football (object)|football]] into their opponent's end zone by passing the ball, running the ball down the field, or kicking the ball through their opponent's goal posts.

Known simply as "football" in North America.

For tagging purposes this may also be used for all other Gridiron Football depictions due to their similarities in equipment.

title: rugby
body:
A team sport played between two teams of either thirteen players (in rugby league) or fifteen players (in rugby union) using a ovoid [[rugby ball]]. There are quite a number of differences between the two codes of rugby ([1]).

The object of the game is to score by either:

* Touching the ball on the area of the pitch behind the goalposts, thereby scoring a "try" worth either four points (in rugby league) or five points (in rugby union), followed by an attempt of a "conversion", an attempt to send the ball between the goalposts and over the crossbar between them, which is worth two points in both rugby codes.
* Penalty goals, done in a similar fashion to a conversion, worth either three points (in rugby union) or two points (in rugby league).
* Drop goals, worth either three points (in rugby union) or one point (in rugby league).

h4. See also
* [[American football]]
* [[rugby ball]]
* [[American football (object)]]
* [[playing sports]]
* [[tag group:sports]]

h4. External links

* [1] "Wikipedia: Comparison of rugby league and rugby union":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_rugby_league_and_rugby_union

title: rugby_ball
body:
The oval-shaped [[ball]]s used in [[rugby]].  🏉

Appearance-wise modern rugby balls are sort of a cross between a [[soccer ball]] and [[American football (object)|balls used in American football]].  They tend to be more colorful, frequently having a white base with other colors on top, while American footballs are traditionally only a solid brown.  Modern rugby balls also tend to lack the laces on the side that are a standard feature on American footballs.  Shape-wise a Rugby ball has slightly rounder ends compared to an American football.

h4. See also
* [[rugby]]
* [[American football (object)]]
* [[American football]]

title: biretta
body:
A square cap with three flat projections on top, worn by Roman Catholic clergymen except for the Pope. Cardinals wear scarlet red birettas; bishops amaranth red; and priests, deacons, and seminarians black.

h4. See also

* [[mitre]]
* [[zucchetto]]

title: zucchetto
body:
A small round [[skullcap]] worn by [[Christianity|Christian]] clergymen. Typically associated with clergymen of the Catholic Church, though is also worn in the Syriac Orthodox Church and some Protestant churches. It is customary for the zuchetto to be worn under the [[biretta]] and [[mitre]]. 

In Catholicism, the [[pope]] has a white zuchetto, and cardinals have a red zuchetto. It can also be seen in purple and black, typically by bishops and [[priest]]s/deacons respectively.

Also known as a pilelous, its official name, but also sometimes designated as a berettino, calotte, subbiretum, submitrale, or soli-deo.

body: A 1966 American live-action television series starring [[Adam West]] as [[Bruce Wayne]]/[[Batman]] and Burt Ward as [[Dick Grayson]]/Robin—two crime-fighting heroes who defend Gotham City from a variety of archvillains. title: maya_(culture)
body:
An ancient culture from [[Guatemala]] and [[Mexico]]. 

The geographic extent of the Maya civilization, known as the Maya area, extended throughout the southern Mexican states of Chiapas, Tabasco, and the Yucatán Peninsula states of Quintana Roo, Campeche and [[Yucatan]]. The Maya area also extended throughout the northern Central American region, including the present-day nations of Guatemala, Belize, El Salvador and western Honduras.

[b]The Maya[/b] is a Mesoamerican civilization, noted for the only known fully developed written language of the pre-Columbian Americas, as well as its art, architecture, and mathematical and astronomical systems. 

Initially established during the Pre-Classic period (c. 2000 BC to 250 AD), according to the Mesoamerican chronology, many Maya cities reached their highest state development during the Classic period (c. 250 AD to 900 AD), and continued throughout the Post-Classic period until the arrival of the Spanish. 

At its peak, it was one of the most densely populated and culturally dynamic societies in the world.

Mexico (Spanish: México), officially the United Mexican States ([i]Estados Unidos Mexicanos[/i]) is a country in North America. title: organ_(instrument)
body:
A class of keyboard [[instrument]] characterized by various sounds of unlimited sustain. The earliest common organs were [[pipe organ]]s built for churches. Their sound came from pressurized air moving through specially formed metal pipes. Pipe organs are still in use in many Western churches and concert halls worldwide.

The [[pump organ]] (see post #657165) is a small pipe organ conceived for home use. The air in this instrument is generated by foot-pedal bellows, which one pumps with alternating feet.

There are also [[electric organ]]s (such as found at post #519301) whose sounds are generated through circuits. The Hammond B3 is arguably the most famous of this type, widely used in jazz, blues and rock music.

A prominent feature of most types of organs is the existence of at least two manuals (keyboard sets; with a light, spring-weighted action unlike that of a piano), a pedalboard, and a number of "stops" or switches which activate different sets of pipes for varied color.

h4. See also

* [[electric organ]]
* [[pipe organ]]
* [[pump organ]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: kpop_demon_hunters
body:
[b]KPop Demon Hunters[/b] is a 2025 3D animated action musical movie created by [[Sony]] Pictures Animation and released on [[Netflix]] on June 20, 2025. It is currently the most watched title in the platform's history.

The movie follows the [[K-Pop]] girl group Huntrix (stylized HUNTR/X), composed of [[Rumi (kpop demon hunters)|]], [[Mira (kpop demon hunters)|]] and [[Zoey (kpop demon hunters)|]], who are secretly the latest trio in a line of demon hunting songstresses. For generations, they have protected the human world from demons sent by the Demon King [[gwi-ma (kpop demon hunters)|Gwi-Ma]] by fighting them and using their singing to empower the Honmoon, a barrier between the two worlds. However, Huntrix faces their most difficult challenge when a new boy band called the Saja Boys, who are actually demons in disguise, attempt to take over Huntrix's popularity and steal their fans’ souls to break the Honmoon.

She is usually depicted wearing purple [[bikini armor]] with [[gold trim|gold-trimmed]] purple [[pauldrons]] and a [[purple cape]]. She also wears [[purple gloves|purple]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[purple boots|purple]] [[thigh boots]], both with white [[fur trim]].

Dela also carries a metallic [[mage staff]] tipped with a socketed crystalline purple [[orb]].

The overall impression of Dela's appearance is basically a "black magician girl" sorceress. Dela is a magic user, and her chief motivation in chasing down the protagonist [[Ares Toraernos]] is to avenge the death of her master.

Also known as Alexis in the English SNES version of the first [[Brandish]], and Dora Doran in [i]Brandish: The Dark Revenant[/i].

title: blue_archive_2025_hack
body:
On August 31, 2025 [[Blue Archive]] was hacked, which caused a massive amount of [[Koyuki (Blue Archive)|]] (and, in some cases, either [[Hatsune Miku]] or every single student that was released, including alternate and crossover character) chibis to spawn in the player's cafe. Some banner pickups and events were also replaced by pictures of Koyuki.

The game was subsequently taken down for maintenance, as memes started spreading about the incident.

The incident only seemed to have affected the Korean and Global versions; there are no reports of it having occured on the Japanese and Chinese version. Despite this, users in Japan still got wind of the event through other channels with some "joining in the fun," so to speak.

August 31 also happened to be [[Suzumi (Blue Archive)|]]’s [[birthday]]. As one of the most overlooked students, a few fans pitied her as well. It was also the birthday of both [[Hatsune Miku]] (hence, her inclusion in the hack) and the game's production director, Kim Young-ha.

h4. Examples

* !asset #31800142
* !asset #31800159

body:

The last panel zooms into an [[iris shot]]. One of many memes/emotes born thanks to her reluctance towards eating monsters, a running gag of the series.

title: elysia_(honkai_impact)
body:
A [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] character. One of the [[Thirteen Flame-Chasers (honkai impact)|]], codenamed [b]Ego[/b], voiced by [[Inoue Marina]] in Japanese. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[pointy ears]]. She first appears at the end of Chapter 25 to greet [[Raiden Mei]] and guide her through the memories of the Flame-Chasers in the Elysian Realm. She is also the Previous Era's Thirteenth Herrscher, the Herrscher of Origin.

If the picture depicts Elysia with [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]], tag as [[Herrscher of Corruption]] instead.

title: reflection
body:
Images that feature a reflection - that is, a mirrored subject on any reflective surface. The reflection may even be [[reflection focus|the main focus of the image]].

Reflections might even depict [[different reflection|something entirely different]].

For images that depict "a reflection inside a reflection", see [[recursion]].

h4. Types 
* [[Eye reflection]]
* [[Mirror]]s
* [[Reflective ceiling]]
* [[Reflective floor]]
* [[Reflective surface]]
* [[Reflective water]]

h4. See Also
* [[Bad reflection]] ([[artistic error]])
* [[Moon reflection]]
* [[No reflection]]
* [[Looking at reflection]]
