title: charlotte_linlin
body:
Charlotte Linlin, better known as [b]"Big Mom"[/b], is a character from [[One Piece]]. One of the Four Emperors and the female pirate with the highest bounty in the world.

"Big Mom" is the leader of the titular Big Mom Pirates, who gained the nickname for the infamous tactic of "marrying" men of various races for the sole purpose of siring children to use them as political pawns to arrange marriages with various countries under her influence. She has 43 "husbands" (all of whom were immediately abandoned as soon as their child was born), 46 sons, and 39 daughters, and had given birth every year until she was 60 years old.

Having eaten (by [spoiler]likely having unwittingly eaten the previous user of the fruit, [[Carmel (one Piece)|]], in an eating frenzy on her sixth birthday[/spoiler]) the Soru Soru no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], Big Mom has the ability to manipulate the soul of anyone who has a fear of death or allowed her to do so, which allows her to cut the lifespan of that soul and put it inside various objects. She created various familiars with these powers to supplement her already superhuman strength in battle.

h4. See also
* [[Napoleon (one piece)|]]
* [[Zeus (one piece)|]]
* [[Prometheus (one piece)|]]
* [spoiler][[Hera (one piece)|]][/spoiler]
other_names: シャーロット・リンリン

title: tiki_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Tiki[/b] (Chiki) is a playable character in several games of the [[Fire Emblem]] series of strategy RPGs. She is the Princess of the Divine Dragon tribe, and therefore much older than she appears to be. She first appears as a 500-year-old child in [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and the Blade of Light]] and [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem]], and reappears [[aged up|as an adult]] 2,000 years later in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] in a [[ponytail]], [[green eyes]] and [[pointy ears]]. [[Tiki_(young)_(fire_emblem)|As a child]], she wears a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]], while [[Tiki_(adult)_(fire_emblem)|as an adult]] she wears a short [[red dress|red]] [[strapless dress]] with [[side slit]]s, a pink [[cape]], red [[thigh boots]] over pink [[thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and red [[gloves]]. As both a child and an adult she has a [[hair ornament]] above her forehead.

In-game, her class is Manakete, which gives her the power to change into [[dragon]] form in combat via use of a dragonstone.

Remarkably, her Awakening incarnation ended in the Top 1 of the 2022's Edition of "Choose Your Legends":[https://vote6.campaigns.fire-emblem-heroes.com/en-US/result] (women's side).

title: byzantine_empire
body:
The [b]Byzantine Empire[/b] (Koine Greek: [i]Βασιλεία Ῥωμαίων[/i]), also known as the [b]Eastern Roman Empire[/b], was the continuation of the [[Roman Empire]] in its eastern provinces. 

It lasted from the 5th century AD until its fall to the [[Ottoman Empire]] in 1453. It was a powerful economic, cultural, and military force in the Mediterranean, with its capital in Constantinople (modern-day [[Istanbul]], Turkey). While its citizens identified themselves Romans, it is distinct from the earlier Roman Empire due to factors like the shift of the capital, the integration of Christianity, and the use of Greek instead of Latin.

Over its history, the Byzantine Empire went through periods of expansion and decline. It reached its peak under Emperor [[Justinian the Great]], reconquering previous western Mediterranean territories. It faced challenges from conflicts, including the "Byzantine-Sasanian Wars":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman%E2%80%93Persian_Wars#Byzantine%E2%80%93Sasanian_wars and "Muslim conquests":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Early_Muslim_conquests, which led to the loss of key provinces. The "Macedonian dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macedonian_dynasty oversaw a revival, but it eventually declined due to "civil wars":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Byzantine_revolts_and_civil_wars and the "Fourth Crusade":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fourth_Crusade, which divided its territories.

Making a brief recovery in 1261, the Byzantine Empire remained a regional power until its fall in 1453. The "Fall of Constantinople":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fall_of_Constantinople marked the end of the empire and the start of the early modern period. Refugees from Constantinople played a role in the [[Renaissance]], and the fall of the "Empire of Trebizond":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empire_of_Trebizond followed shortly after.

Its existence has a lasting legacy, particularly in the fields of art, architecture, law, and Christianity, which continue to influence the world to this day. It should be noted that the name "Byzantine" is actually modern term used by Historians to differentiate it from the Western Roman Empire that fell as the Byzantines at the time still called themselves as "Romans".

h4. See also

* [[Roman Empire]]
* [[Hagia Sophia]] - a former Byzantine church, turned mosque

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Byzantine Empire":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byzantine_Empire]
* "Wikipedia: Byzantine Greeks":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byzantine_Greeks]

title: little_bel_(azur_lane)
body:
A [[aged down|younger]] version of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Belfast (azur lane)|]], also called "[i]Bel-chan[/i]".

Created when Belfast walked in on an experiment being conducted by [[Akashi (azur lane)|]] and [[Yuubari (azur lane)|]]. She refers to herself as Belfast and refers to her regular version or adult counterpart as her older sister. Her regular/adult counterpart explains that as a shipgirl, she was born in her current form and was never younger or smaller. No one was able to explain exactly what Belchan is in-game.

title: neo_universe_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. Voiced by [[Shiraishi Haruka (Voice Actor)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] ([[blonde hair|blonde]] with [[blue hair|blue]] inner) with a lightning-shaped [[ahoge]], and [[blue eyes]]. Personality-wise, she talks and acts as if she came from space. Despite her eccentric personality, she is often very affectionate to her [[Trainer (umamusume)|]], as she is aware she is living in a different universe and went there due to her love and desire of meeting her trainer who is apparently an alternate universe version of Neo Universe's real life jockey [[Mirco Demuro]].

Notable for being the first Shadai Group horse to be implemented in the franchise since [[Orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|Orfevre]]'s and [[Buena Vista (old Design) (umamusume)|Buena Vista]]'s tentative appearances in the franchise's earliest days. In this case, being from Shadai Race Horse instead of Sunday Racing.

body:

Also a supporting character in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] series, a fighter in [[Super Smash Bros.]], and a hidden character in [[Final Fantasy Tactics]]. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]] and Cody Christian in Japanese and English.

title: czechoslovak_army
body:
[[Czechoslovakia]]'s principal [[army|armed]] forces, established in 1918 following Czechoslovakia's declaration of independence from [[Austria-Hungary]]. It would later be formally renamed the Czechoslovak People's Army in 1954 after a period of Sovietisation. They would revert to their former name in 1990 but then dissolved upon the Dissolution of Czechoslovakia in 1993. Use this tag for images depicting its [[logo]] or characters wearing the [[military uniform|uniform]]. 

This tag can also be used to depict the Czechoslovak Legion, a volunteer army that fought on the side of the Entente during [[World War I]] before their nation was formed, and famously had to travel the entire length of the Trans-Siberian Railway through the [[Russian Civil War]] to head back home.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Czechoslovak Army":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czechoslovak_Army
* "Wikipedia: Czechoslovak People's Army":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czechoslovak_People%27s_Army
* "Wikipedia: Czechoslovak Legion":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czechoslovak_Legion

title: twitter_header_won't_fit_(meme)
body:
A trend on [[Twitter]] where users post a screenshot of attempting to update their profile header with an image that is too large to fit, forcing them to choose a narrow section of the image that fits the header space.

This trend seems to have originated in 2019 and saw a revival in 2023 and again in 2025, each time with the same basic concept but used for different intentions. The current 2025 trend is mainly from Japanese artists using this meme as a template to highlight specific parts of an image/character, sometimes having them go [[outside border|outside the border]] or break the [[fourth wall]].

h4. External links

* "KnowYourMeme article: Twitter Header Won't Fit / How Do I Fit This Into My Header?":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/twitter-header-wont-fit-how-do-i-fit-this-into-my-header]
other_names: うまくヘッダーに収まらない...

title: commentary_request
body:
A post with an artist [[commentary]] that has not been fully translated into English.

To translate the commentary, click the [b]Add commentary[/b] link and place the translated title and commentary inside their respective fields. When the translation is complete, remove this tag and replace it with [[commentary]]. If the translation is incomplete or needs review, leave the [[commentary request]] tag and add the [[partial commentary]] or [[check commentary]] tags.

Do not tag an image as [[translation request]] when the commentary is untranslated. [[Translation request]] is for text inside the image.

h4. See Also

* [[commentary]]
* [[check commentary]]
* [[missing commentary]]
* [[english commentary]]

title: anchorage_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the heavy cruiser USS [i]Anchorage[/i], as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. Character design by [[Lal!Role]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] light [[brown hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit consists of a black top that shows her [[cleavage]], a white [[sleeves past wrists|long-sleeved]] dress over it and tied to the front, black [[micro shorts]], a single [[thigh strap]] to her right leg, [[fold-over boots]], and a large [[blue coat]] with black [[drawstring]]s. Her [[rigging]] consists of her three intended 20.3 cm triple gun mounts on wavy pieces of white-colored hull, as well as a white metal [[halo]].

Historically, she was the [i]8-inch Cruiser Study Scheme CA-B[/i] that examined heavy cruiser designs (that ultimately led to the [[Baltimore (Azur Lane)|]] design) that incorporated a fourth 203 mm/8-inch triple main gun mount and two 533 mm quad torpedo tubes.

title: american_football_(object)
body:
The oval-shaped [[ball]]s used in [[American football]]. 🏈

The balls used in American football are brown, feature laces on the side, and have a white strip toward both ends.  They're similar to [[rugby ball]]s, but those can come in a wider variety of colors, frequently lack the laces, and do not have the stripes.  American footballs also have pointer ends than a rugby ball.

For association football, see [[soccer ball]].

h4. See also
* [[American football]]
* [[rugby ball]]
* [[rugby]]
* [[soccer ball]]
* [[soccer]]

Her default outfit consists of a [[white jacket|white military jacket]] exposing her [[cleavage]], white [[peaked cap]], [[pantyhose]], [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]], and [[black gloves]]. title: matikanetannhauser_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by Tono Hikaru.

A bubbly yet surpisingly normal girl with a long name and a cute catchphrase. Due to her clumsiness or poor luck, she often gets [[nosebleed]]s. "Machitan" is a member of Team Canopus in the anime, being effectively the optimistic [[clumsy|klutz]] of the team. She is also take notes in her efforts to become better.

Nicknamed as [[Mambo_(meme)|]], because of her 7th story chapter in which she performs a small dance at a festival, muttering "まんぼ、まんぼ、お祭りーまんぼ〜".

title: tokai_teio_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Saitou Machiko]] (replacing [[Inami Anju]]).

She is the main character of the second season of the anime adaptation.

A somewhat [[tomboy]]ish girl who idolizes [[Symboli Rudolf_(umamusume)|]]. Notably, her second costume is marching band/military inspired.

Occasionally appears alongside [[Symboli Rudolf (Umamusume)|]] due to the former being the real-life sire of the race horse she's based on. See the "Dark Side of the Horse":[/pools/17253] pool for more information.

title: yamato_(sword)
body: [[Vergil (devil may cry)|]]'s trademark dark-forged blade appearing in the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series. It is a legendary sword that was once wielded by his father [[Sparda]], and was left to Vergil as a keepsake. It resembles a Japanese [[katana|Ōkatana]] and is imbued with tremendous magic, being able to cut through anything.

title: dante_(devil_may_cry)
body:
[b]The Legendary Devil Hunter, Dante[/b]

[b]Dante[/b] is the main protagonist in the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series. He is the son of [[Sparda]] and [[Eva (devil may cry)|]], the twin brother of [[Vergil (devil may cry)|]], and the paternal uncle of [[Nero (devil may cry)|]]. As such, he is a half-demon.

A demon hunter by trade, he owns the eponymous shop named after the series. Wielding his sword [[Rebellion (sword)|]] and twin pistols [[Ebony & Ivory]], he became a devil killer to avenge the death of his mother and protect humankind.

Unlike Vergil, he also displays a spunky, cocky attitude. Voiced by Reuben Langdon in North America, and [[Morikawa Toshiyuki]] in Japan.

title: ebony_&_ivory
body:
[b]Ebony & Ivory[/b] are [[dante_(devil_may_cry)|Dante's]] trademark pair of personally customized, semi-automatic [[handgun|pistols]], designed to rapidly fire [[bullet|bullets]] instilled with demonic power.

The silver gun, Ivory, was custom built for rapid firing and fast draw times, while the black gun, Ebony, has been modified for long-distance targeting and comfort.

Ebony & Ivory are both [[m1911|M1911-style]] handguns chambered for the .45 ACP round, and boast a plethora of customized features.

Use this tag for either both guns or just one of them.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

title: rebellion_(sword)
body: [[dante_(devil_may_cry)|Dante]]'s trademark sword that appears in the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] video game series, [[Shin Megami Tensei III: Nocturne]], and The Animated Series. It's a magical blade given to him as a keepsake from his father, and it serves as both a physical manifestation of his power, and through it's name, meaning "resistance", a symbol of his spirit. The blade's power originally laid dormant, but through contact with Dante's blood, was awakened.

title: northampton_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s depiction of USS [i]Northampton[/i] (CL/CA-26), which was the nameship of six Northampton-class cruiser of the United States Navy. She is named after the city of "Northampton, Massachusetts":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northampton,_Massachusetts].

Visually, Northampton has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[green eyes]], and a [[large_breasts|well-endowed chest]] as well as [[semi-rimless_eyewear|semi-rimless glasses]], making her the second ever [[glasses]]-wearing foreign shipgirl, the first among the Allies. She wears a stylized [[naval uniform]] similar to the one seen in sister [[Houston_(kancolle)|]]:  A [[corset]], white ribbed sleeves, and a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], a [[black_pantyhose|black]] [[thighband pantyhose]], [[shin guards]], and high-heeled [[rudder footwear]]. She also has a white peaked cap. Her machinery consists of a [[smokestack]], a crane, and two large cannon turrets, each having three barrels. Houston has a remodelled form where torpedo launchers are added to her machinery among other upgrades and a darker paint job and she switches to black ribbed sleeves.

In her damaged CG in both forms, a PT boat is seen, presumably PT-109 which rescued several survivors of her sinking during Battle of Tassafaronga. Other survivors were saved by the crew of USS [[Fletcher (kancolle)|]] using cork-floated cargo nets. Fans used this as a connection for shipgirl Northamption somewhat resembling an older and taller shipgirl Fletcher.

Clipped on Northampton's hair to the right is a [[Navy Cross]], similar to the one posthumously awarded to Chief Engineer/Commander Hilan Ebert, the most senior officer aboard the historical cruiser who was killed during the Battle of Tassafaronga. Her captain, Willard A. Kitts, was also awarded the Navy Cross for his handling of the evacuation, although he survived her sinking.

h4. [i]Northampton[/i]-class Heavy Cruisers
* [b]Northampton[/b] (CA-26)
* [[Houston (Kancolle)|]] (CA-30)

title: yatamomo
body:
A [[yaoi]] manga written and illustrated by [[harada]]. It was serialized in [i]Qpa[/i] from 2013 to 2017.

It follows the life of a useless, good-for-nothing man named [[Momota_(yatamomo)|]] or "Momo" after he takes advantage of a younger man named [[Yata_(yatamomo)|]]'s kindness and forces himself into his home. While spending time with Yata, little-by-little, Momota begins to change his ways.

The manga has a prequel called SuMomo that delves into the relationship between Momota and another man named [[Suda_(yatamomo)|]] who appears only briefly in YataMomo.

title: vergil_(devil_may_cry)
body:
[b]The Alpha and the Omega, Vergil[/b]

Vergil is the older of the twin sons of [[Sparda]] and [[Eva (Devil May Cry)|]], and is the main antagonist of [[Devil May Cry 3]]. 
Unlike [[Dante (devil_may_cry)|]], his younger brother, he embraces his demonic heritage and despises his human one. His personality is a complete opposite to Dante's; whereas Dante is hot-headed and sarcastic, Vergil is cold-blooded and sardonic. He has a lust for power and is willing to disregard anything to obtain the power of his father, Sparda, a trait that stemmed from their mother's death, and his helplessness back then. 

When his lust for power didn't get in the way, he will at times ally with Dante, to the point of using Dante's guns, a weapon he personally despises.

He uses [[Yamato (sword)|]], a keepsake from his father, and possesses a sense of style which rivals Dante's. 

After being decimated in the story as [[Nelo Angelo]], he is said to have been survived by his son, [[Nero (devil_may_cry)|]].

Voiced by Daniel Southworth in English and [[Hirata Hiroaki]] in Japanese.

h4. See Also
* [[Vergil's Chair (meme)|]]
* [[Vergil Status (meme)|]]
other_names: バージル(デビルメイクライ)

title: nero_(devil_may_cry)
body:
[b]The Devil Hunter, Nero[/b]

Nero is the main protagonist of [[Devil May Cry 4]], whom Sanctus makes multiple references to being "a descendant with Sparda's blood". He's a Holy Knight in the Order of the Sword, a religious order that worships Sparda and fights to protect the world from demons, also fighting to protect his childhood friend and love interest [[kyrie (devil may cry)|]]. 

He wields the [[Red Queen (sword)]], the [[Blue Rose (gun)]], and the [[Devil Bringer]], later lost and stolen in [[Devil May Cry 5]]. Voiced by [[Johnny Yong Bosch]] in North America, and [[Ishikawa Kaito|Kaito Ishikawa]] in Japan.

[spoiler]He is later revealed in DMC5 that he is the son of [[Vergil (devil may cry)|]], as he has an innate resonance with his father's sword, the [[Yamato_(sword)|Yamato]], though there are multiple sources from [[Capcom]], including Hideaki Atsuno, that confirm Vergil's paternity over Nero that wasn't incorporated in DMC4's story for flexibility prior to the game's release.

title: devil_may_cry_(series)
body:
[b]Devil May Cry[/b] is a series of five hack and slash video games. The series was developed by [[Capcom]] and created by Kamiya Hideki.

Originally intended to be a sequel in Capcom's [[Resident Evil]] series, Devil May Cry was such a radical departure from the series' style that it was developed into a new property entirely. The series is set in a modern world, and centers on main character [[Dante (devil may cry)|Dante's]] goal of avenging his mother's murder by exterminating demons.

The gameplay consists of heavy combat scenes in which the player must attempt to extend long chains of attacks while avoiding damage in order to exhibit stylized combat; this element along with time and amount of items collected and used are taken under consideration when grading the player's performance.

title: female_corrin_(fire_emblem)
body:
The female version of Corrin from [[Fire Emblem Fates]]. As an avatar character, Corrin's name, gender, appearance, and voice are customizable by the player.

Supposedly born to Hoshidan royalty, Corrin was kidnapped at an early age and raised in Nohr. Carrying ancient dragon blood, they are able to tap the power of Dragon Veins to manipulate the territory around them. They are also able to turn into a [[dragon]], though they normally only do so involuntarily and out of insanity. As a result, Corrin keeps a [[dragonstone]] on their person to assume full control of their transforming powers.

Her dragon form and gentle personality are strongly based on the [[qilin (mythology)|]], a chimerical creature that, in Chinese mythology, primarily symbolizes benevolence and fortune. It is said to foretell the birth or arrival of an illustrious ruler or great human being.

Voiced by [[Satou Satomi]] in Japanese and Marcella Lentz-Pope in English, with the other voice options in [[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]] voiced by Danielle Judovits and "Stephanie Lemelin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephanie_Lemelin.

body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Oohashi Ayaka]].

She is determined to live the cool life, no matter where the road of life takes her. Being influenced by her bike-loving father, Vodka grew up to have the same interests and hobbies, always talking about the latest bikes, and shares his same beliefs with a strong conviction. title: kitasan_black_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Yano Hinaki]]. 

A cheerful and energetic girl who innocently takes up any challenges. She looks up to [[Tokai Teio (Umamusume)|]] and idolizes her. Her general motif is based on Japanese [[festival]]s. In the anime, she was a supporting character during Season 2. She would later become the protagonist of Season 3 and a member of Team Spica.

She is most infamous for her "SSR Support Speed card":[https://gametora.com/umamusume/supports/30028-kitasan-black] (see post #9671126). Given how early in the game's lifespan it was released, it was one of the best cards in the game and stayed that way for a very long time, thanks to her massive Specialty Priority rating at higher levels.

The original horse's name wasn't named because he had a black or brown coat (he was a simple bay), but rather after his sire, [[Black Tide (racehorse)|]], an older full brother to the much more successful [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]].

title: umamusume
body:
[b]Umamusume: Pretty Derby[/b] is a mobile gacha game developed and published by [[Cygames]] featuring [[horse girl]]s based on famous [[horse|racehorses]].

The game was first announced in 2016 and was initially slated for a Fall 2018 release, only for development to start out from scratch; with the ultimate release date pushed back to Febuary 2021. An English version of the game released on June 26, 2025. A party game spinoff, [[Umamusume: Party Dash]], was released in 2024.

The franchise received several anime adaptations, with the first season airing before the game's official release in Spring 2018, and a second season launching alongside the game in Winter 2021. A spinoff featuring [[Narita Top Road (Umamusume)|]] was aired for Spring 2023. The third season premiered in Fall 2023, followed by an anime film centered on [[Jungle Pocket (Umamusume)|]] in May 2024. An anime adaptation of the manga [[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]] is currently in the works and is slated for a 2025 release.

There is also the [[Umayon]] spinoff, which was a 4koma manga that was adapted into an anime short in 2020, and the [[Umayuru]] spinoff which was released directly on the Umamusume's YouTube channel in Fall 2022.

title: rice_shower_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Iwami Manaka]].

She's a [[horse girl]] with a gothic theme. She is named after the tradition of throwing rice at weddings for good luck. She's a member of Team Sirius in the game.
She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown_hair|brown]] [[flipped hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair_over_one_eye|covering her right eye]] decorated with a [[tilted_headwear|tilted]] [[blue_hat|dark blue hat]] and [[purple eyes]].

title: stefano_valentini
body:
Stefano Valentini is the secondary antagonist of the survival-horror game The Evil Within 2. He acts as the main enemy to Sebastian Castellanos through Chapters 1-8.
 Originally a war photographer, Stefano lost an eye whilst photographing the horrors of war and his descent into insanity began. One fateful day, he caught on camera the exact moment a person in front of him was shredded to pieces by the same explosion that took away his right eye. Growing obsessed with the imagery captured, he began to see only true beauty in one thing - the exact moment of every creature's death - and began sharing his vision with the world.
other_names: ステファノ・ヴァレンティーニ

title: aule
body:
Aulë [ˈaʊle] - "Invention") was an Ainu, one of the Aratar and the Vala responsible for fashioning and crafting the substances of which Arda, the world, was composed.

He was also called Mahal (Khuzdûl: "Maker"), Oli (Sindarin: "Dream"), and Návatar, and delighted in the nature of substances and in works of skill, but was not concerned with possession or mastery. Besides the shaping of Arda, Aulë's greatest works were the Two Lamps of the Valar, the vessels of the Sun and Moon, and the Dwarves.

He also created Angainor, the chain of [[morgoth|Melkor]].

title: mambo_(meme)
body: Nickname for [[Matikanetannhauser (Umamusume)|]] given to her from overseas fans. The phrase originated from her 7th story chapter in which she performs a small dance at a festival, muttering "まんぼ、まんぼ、お祭りーまんぼ〜".

title: yaoi
body:
Any romantic or sexual interaction between males, whether mutual or one-sided. If it's mutual, consider also adding the [[couple]] tag.

In Japan, "yaoi" is used to refer to NSFW content, while "boy's love" is used to refer to SFW content. On Danbooru, "yaoi" is used for both; use {{yaoi is:nsfw}} or {{yaoi is:sfw}} to distinguish between them.

For physical objects depicting yaoi, use [[yaoi (object)]] in combination with [[fujoshi]], [[fudanshi]], and/or [[otaku]] instead. 

For Danbooru purposes, [[cuntboy]] is not yaoi. Use [[cuntboy with male]] or [[cuntboy with cuntboy]] instead.

For Danbooru purposes, bisexual male activity is also not yaoi. Use [[bisexual male]] instead.

title: archery_shooting_glove
body: A three-fingered [[gloves|glove]] used by those practicing western archery to protect the ring, middle, and index finger of the hand used to pull a bowstring.  Used for the same purpose as a [[yugake]], but those cover the middle finger, index finger, and thumb instead.

title: finger_cots
body:
Also known as [b]finger protectors[/b] or [b]finger gloves[/b]. A covering worn on the fingers; think of reverse fingerless gloves.  
They're typically worn in instances where protecting the fingers are necessary, but when regular [[gloves]] aren't needed, such as certain medical procedures, electronics manufacturing, watchmaking, etc. 

Disposable latex finger cots have been nicknamed "finger condoms" because of their visual similarity to [[condom]]s.

h4. Example
* !post #7055801

h4. See also
* [[thimble]]
* [[fingerless gloves]]
* [[half gloves]]

title: half_gloves
body:
Half gloves are a style of [[gloves|glove]] where either only the fingers are covered or the material of the glove falls noticeably short of the wrist.

The term "half gloves" is also used to refer to fingerless gloves, but for that style of glove use the [[fingerless gloves]] tag instead. The overlap in name usage may be due to gloves only covering the fingers being a fairly new fashion, with the style initially appearing in European fashion shows in 2006.

body:

The costume is also available in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]]. She wears [[Sothis (fire emblem)|]]'s costume with additional [[detached sleeves]] and [[pantyhose]].

title: mma_gloves
body:
A type of [[fingerless gloves]] designed to protect the user's hands with some padding while leaving the user's hands uncovered to maximize grappling manoevers.

Typically used in various combat sports where grappling and clinching is allowed, such as [[mixed martial arts]].

title: mixed_martial_arts
body:
Mixed martial arts (MMA), sometimes referred to as cage fighting, is a full-contact combat sport based on striking, grappling and ground fighting, incorporating techniques from various combat sports from around the world.

MMA matches typically take place in an [[octagonal ring|octagonal cage]], although some [[fighting]] promotions have used [[boxing]] or [[wrestling]] rings instead. Originally, MMA was intended to pit combatants of different [[martial arts]] schools against each other to find the most effective martial art in street fighting. Nowadays, MMA combatants commonly cross-train in multiple martial arts such as [[judo]], Brazilian jiu-jitsu, [[karate]], [[muay thai]], [[boxing]] and [[wrestling]] among others.

h4. See also
* [[MMA gloves]]
* [[choke hold]]
* [[joint lock]]

title: morning_glory
body:
A common name for more than 1000 species of [[flower]]ing plants in the [i]Convolvulaceae[/i] family.

The [[plant]] bears funnel-shaped flowers that close late in the day. They are known for their five symmetrical, finely overlapping petals and bright colors in shades of pink, red, blue, and purple; the center is often white. The flowers often have a distinctive star shape in the center, which is often emphasized by artists. Depending on the species, the leaves can be heart-shaped or ivy-shaped (three-lobed). Morning glory [[vines]] are often trained to climb [[trellis]]es but will eagerly climb [[fence]]s as well.

As morning glories are easy to grow, Japanese elementary schools often have their students grow them as part of their plant cultivation experience. It is typical summer homework for Japanese students to bring home the morning glories (that they have grown to a certain extent at school) and observe and record their growth (note that summer vacation is in the middle of the school year in Japan).

Its common Japanese name, アサガオ (朝顔 [i]asa-gao[/i]), literally translates to "morning face". There is a night-blooming species, [i]Ipomoea alba[/i], commonly called [[moonflower (flower)|]]. Its common Japanese name is ヨルガオ (夜顔 [i]yoru-gao[/i]), which literally translates to "night face".

h4. Examples

* !post #6225060
* !post #6882035
* !post #7919920: Morning glories on trellis
* !post #4801789: [[Moonflower (flower)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Ivy]]
* [[Morning glory print]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ipomoea (Morning glory)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ipomoea
* "Wikipedia: Ipomoea indica":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ipomoea_indica
* "Wikipedia: Ipomoea nil (Japanese morning glory)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ipomoea_nil
* "Wikipedia: Ipomoea purpurea":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ipomoea_purpurea
* "Wikipedia: Ipomoea tricolor":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ipomoea_tricolor
* "Wikipedia: Convolvulaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convolvulaceae

title: artist_glove
body:
An artist glove is a  [[gloves|glove]] that [[partially fingerless gloves|only covers the pinky and ring finger]] while leaving the middle finger, index finger, and thumb free to manipulate a [[pen]], [[pencil]], or [[stylus]] when [[drawing (action)|]]. These gloves work to prevent smudging while drawing on traditional media and reduce friction and grease when drawing on a [[drawing tablet]]. Also known as an anti-fouling artist glove, smudge protector, and two finger drawing glove.

Typically worn only on the drawing hand and not worn as a set.

title: cowgirl_position
body:
A sexual position in which the penetrating partner is lying down and the receiving partner is [[straddling]] them while facing towards their partner. The penetrating partner can be a man, [[futanari]], woman with a [[strap-on]], etc.

When the receiving partner is facing away from the penetrating partner they are [[straddling]], use [[reverse cowgirl position]].

If the receiving partner is [[squatting]], also use [[squatting cowgirl position]].

h4. See Also

title: female_byleth_(fire_emblem)
body:
Female version of [[byleth_(fire_emblem)|Byleth]], the protagonist character of [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]. Has [[medium_hair|medium-length]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[black coat]] like a cape, [[black shorts]] over a patterned set of [[pantyhose]], and an armored [[bustier]] that exposes her [[navel]].

title: the_magic_school_bus
body:
A series of children's books about science. They feature the antics of [[Ms. Frizzle]] and her class, who board a sentient [[anthropomorphization|anthropomorphic]] mini [[school bus]] which takes them on field trips to mainly impossible locations, including across the world, [[space]], the [[time travel|past]] and microscopic regions.

It received a series of animated adaptations, including the original television series of the same name in 1994 and [i]The Magic School Bus Rides Again[/i] in 2017.

title: silver_bullet_suppressor
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Narrative]].

[b]ARX-014S Silver Bullet Suppressor[/b]

A special modified version of the Silver Bullet, itself a Federation version of the [[Doven Wolf|Döven Wolf]], equipped with an arm replacement system and sub-manipulators that enable it to fire the mighty Beam Magnum. 

[spoiler]The mysterious unit was piloted by [[Banagher Links]] as he supported [[Jona Basta]] and the [[Unicorn Gundam Phenex]] against [[Zoltan Akkanen]] and the [[Neo Zeong]].[/spoiler]
other_names: シルヴァ・バレト・サプレッサー

title: no_reason_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character.

A [[samurai]] wannabe, she fashions herself as an officer from the warring states period, likely as a reference to the real horse's post-retirement career taking part in the "Soma Nomaoi":[https://www.city.minamisoma.lg.jp/portal/english/Events_and_Experiences/nomaoi/index.html] festival in Fukushima Prefecture.

body:

Her costume theming implies that she is based on "Dancing Brave":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dancing_Brave], a winner of the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe and real life sire of [[King Halo (umamusume)|]].

title: venus_paques_(umamusume)
body:
An [[Umamusume]] character from France and one of the rivals the player will face in the Project L'arc training scenario.

Based on her connection with [[Montjeu (umamusume)|]] in the campaign, some believe she is based on "Trêve":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treve_%28horse%29], who was the undefeated winner who won the Prix Arc de Triomphe twice.

other_names: ヴェニュスパーク(ウマ娘)

title: speed_symboli_(umamusume)
body:
NPC from [[Umamusume]]. She is Japan's first horse to go "gamble" at the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe, starting Japan's fascination with that particular race, and is considered to be a pioneer for going overseas to run in some of the world's most prestigious races.

While in-universe, [[Sirius Symboli (umamusume)|]] is her successor, in real life, Speed Symboli is also [[Symboli Rudolf (umamusume)|]]'s damsire.

Voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #32565852

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Speed Symboli":[https://umamusume.jp/character/speedsymboli]
other_names: スピードシンボリ(ウマ娘)

title: samson_big_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], first appearing in [[Umamusume: Star Blossom]].

A small, ironically named [[horse girl]] who dreams big (and dreams of becoming big). The real horse is infamous for being last or second-to-last in all of the 1994 Triple Crown races (all won by Narita Brian).

title: bitter_glasse_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] game-only character. Member of Team First under Acting Chairwoman [[Kashimoto Riko]].

[[Horse girl]]. Has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|brown]] hair and [[brown eyes]]. She has [[dark skin]] and she wears an [[ear ribbon]] around her right ear.

Like [[Happy Meek (umamusume)|]], Bitter Glasse is not based on any real-life horse. However, there's a real-life horse named after [i]her[/i]. [[Bitter Glace (racehorse)|]] (note the different spelling) is a bay filly (not a colt as one would expect from the ear decoration placement) sired by [[Rulership (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Anthology (racehorse)|]]. Rulership is a son of [[King Kamehameha (racehorse)|]] and [[Air Groove (racehorse)|]] while Anthology is a daughter of [[Sakura Bakushin O (racehorse)|]] and [[Pops (racehorse)|]] (herself a daughter of [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]]).

As an apparent nod to her, Bitter Glasse is said to go to the Miho dormitory according to dorm head [[Hishi Amazon (umamusume)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5859821

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Bitter Glasse":[https://umamusume.jp/character/bitterglasse]
other_names: ビターグラッセ(ウマ娘)

title: little_cocon_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] game-only character. Member of Team First under Acting Chairwoman [[Kashimoto Riko]].

[[Horse girl]]. Has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair|blonde]] hair (with a single [[blue streaks|blue streak]]) and [[green eyes]]. She also wears a [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow]] positioned in front and to the right of her right ear.

Like [[Happy Meek (umamusume)|]], Little Cocon is not based on any real-life horse. However, there's a real-life horse named after [i]her[/i]. This chestnut colt is a son of [[Big Arthur (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Break Dancer (racehorse)|]]. He is a sire-line grandson of [[Sakura Bakushin O (racehorse)|]] and, on the mother's side, a descendant of [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]] through [[Dance in the Dark (racehorse)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5859823

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Little Cocon":[https://umamusume.jp/character/littlecocon]

title: orfevre_(umamusume)
body:
An [[Umamusume]] character who was the Triple Crown winner of 2011. Referred herself as the "Tyrant". Voiced by [[Hikasa Youko|]].

She first appeared in a [[2016 Umamusume promotional video]] with an [[Orfevre (old design) (Umamusume)|old design]]. When she was added to the game in 2024, she was completely redesigned. No explanation is given for this change, so some fan artists cannot help but add some traits of the 2016 character to this one or speculate some sort of transformation.

Generally drawn together with [[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]], as the latter lacks a "canonical pair" to be drawn with. Sometimes these two are further drawn together with [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)|]] and [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] to form the [[Stay Gold clan (umamusume)|]]. She is also often drawn along with [[Curren Chan (umamusume)|]] or [[Sweep Tosho (umamusume)|]] as they were both ridden by [[Ikezoe Ken'ichi]].

The real life horse is notorious for "playing" with his jockey. 

Her name is French for "Goldsmith".

h4. Appearance

* !post #7252970: [[Tracen School Uniform]]
* !post #8738363: [[Orfevre (Control) (Umamusume)|Control]]
* !post #8896456: [[Orfevre (Control) (Umamusume)|Control]] (Draft)
* !post #8738286: [[starting_future_(umamusume)|Starting Future]]
* !asset #23246905: [[orfevre_(old_design)_(umamusume)|Old design]]

h4. Related characters

* [[Buena Vista (Umamusume)|]] - Rival
* [[Gentildonna (umamusume)|]] - Rival
* [[Win Variation (umamusume)|]] - Rival
* [[Lucky Lilac (umamusume)|]] - Kouhai, real life daughter
*  [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)|]] (Anime stand-in for [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]])

h6. [[Stay Gold Clan (umamusume)|]]

* [[Dream Journey (Umamusume)|]] - Older sister, roommate (they are full brothers in real life, Dream Journey is the eldest by almost 4 years)
* [[Stay Gold (Umamusume)|]] - [[Dream Journey (Umamusume)|]]'s dear "elder sister".
* [[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]]
* [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] - Rival
* [[Fenomeno (umamusume)|]] - Rival

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Orfevre":[https://umamusume.jp/character/orfevre]
other_names: オルフェーヴル(ウマ娘)

title: orfevre_(old_design)_(umamusume)
body:
The original [[prototype design]] of [[Orfevre_(umamusume)|]], which first appeared in a [[2016 Umamusume promotional video]]. When [[Orfevre_(umamusume)|]] was later added to the game in 2024, she was completely redesigned. No explanation was given for this change.

The most salient trait of her 2016 appearance is her [[mouth mask]]. She appears to have a split personality that surfaces when her mask is removed.

h4. Appearance

body:

In contrast to most [[horse girl]]s, she has no real life counterpart.

title: 2016_umamusume_promotional_video
body:
A promotional video released at Anime Japan 2016 to announce the [[Umamusume]] project. One infamous scene includes [[Symboli Rudolf (Umamusume)|]] and [[Oguri Cap (Umamusume)|]] having an ice skating fantasy.

The video is also infamous for featuring [[prototype design]]s of several characters which were ultimately not released or whose reveal was significantly pushed back; namely [[Deep Impact (umamusume)|]], [[King Kamehameha (umamusume)|]], [[orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|Orfevre]], and [[buena vista (old design) (umamusume)|Buena Vista]].

h4. External links

* "YouTube: Umamusume Pretty Derby PV":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HYrVKLBhitE

title: zenless_zone_zero
body:
An action role-playing video game developed by [[miHoYo]]. Released on July 4, 2024.

Set in a post-apocalyptic setting of the city of New Eridu, the player takes the role of [[Wise (zenless zone zero)|]] or [[Belle (zenless zone zero)|]], the sibling "Proxy" agents collectively known as "Phaethon" as they work with gangs, companies, and law enforcement for various tasks.

title: braig
body:
[[Kingdom Hearts]] character. An enigmatic but sarcastic [[gun]]-wielder who first appears in [[kingdom hearts birth by sleep|Birth by Sleep]]. [spoiler]His [[Nobody (kingdom hearts)|]] is [[Xigbar]].[/spoiler]

[spoiler]He is the current vessel of [[Luxu (kingdom hearts)|]].[/spoiler]

title: condom_on_nipples
body:
[[Condom]]s, usually a [[used condom]], tied around the circumference of a nipple (see [[tied nipples]]).

Otherwise, a condom whose opening is wrapped around a nipple/breast in such a way so that the condom can be filled with [[breast milk in container|breast milk]] (see [[lactation into condom]]).

title: luxu_(kingdom_hearts)
body:
[[Keyblade]] master from [i][[kingdom_hearts_x|KINGDOM HEARTS χ]][chi][/i], [i][[kingdom_hearts_x_back_cover|Back Cover]][/i], and [i]Union χ[Cross][/i]. A young man obscured by his [[black coat (kingdom hearts)|]] and carrying the "[[No Name (keyblade)|]]" Keyblade on behalf of the [[Master of Masters]].

[spoiler]The true identity of [[Xigbar]]/[[Braig]], among untold other aliases.[/spoiler]

title: sirius_symboli_(umamusume)
body:
A prideful [[Umamusume]] character with a motto of "Sirius the one brightest star". Her desire is to dominate even global competition. She's brash and foul-mouthed, but how she's got real skills to back up her immense confidence endows her with a charisma of her own. Furthermore, she would never lie thanks to her dislike of dishonesty and underhanded means. Hence, she's naturally charming. She calls her [[Trainer (umamusume)|]] Puppy.

body:

title: angela_(marvel)
body:
Angela is a western Comic Book character created by [[Neil Gaiman]] (Best known for [[The Sandman (Dc)|The Sandman]]), and [[Todd McFarlane]], Co-founder of [[Image Comics]].

She initially debuted as an antagonist in [i][[Spawn (Comic)|Spawn]] #9 (March 1993)[/i], published by Image, as an angelic bounty hunter working under the auspices of Heaven to oppose [[Spawn (spawn)|]]. 

In the 1990s Gaiman and McFarlane entered a legal dispute involving various things, including the rights to Angela, which the former won in 2012. Gaiman briefly worked with Marvel, who supported him during the lawsuit, and would sell the rights them as gratitude. She debuted under Marvel in [i]Age of [[Ultron]] #10 (June 2013)[/i]. The 2014 [i]Original Sin[/i] storyline would retcon her as [b]Aldrif Odinsdottir[/b], daughter of [[Odin (Marvel)|Odin]] and long lost sister of [[Thor (Marvel)|Thor]].

In September 2025, she was introduced as a hero in [[Marvel Rivals]] which revitalized interest in her.

As this character's legal ownership is trivia, and Angela is associated with Marvel these days, both the [i]Spawn[/i] and [i]Marvel[/i] incarnation of Angela qualify for this tag. Take care to acknowledge the context and commentary of the art to decide if a [[Marvel]] tag or [[Spawn (Comic)]] tag applies.

h4. Appearances

h6. Image Comics

* !asset #32517449: Spawn Vol 1 #97 (2000)

title: mobile_suit_gundam
body:
A revolutionary 1979 [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] anime television series. It is the first show in the [[Gundam]] franchise.

Set in the far future, during the year [b]Universal Century 0079[/b] (79 years after the creation of the first permanent colony in [[space]]), it follows the story of [[Amuro Ray]], the teen [[White Base]] crew member and pilot of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] mecha during the [[Earth Federation]]-[[Zeon]] conflict known as "The One Year War". The story of this U.C. series continues in [[Zeta Gundam]].

It was produced by [[Sunrise (company)|]], created by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] and "Yatate Hajime":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate (a collective pseudonym for the entire Sunrise animation staff), with mechanical designs by [[Ookawara Kunio]] and character designs by [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]]. Tomino cited the 1959 novel [[Starship Troopers]] as an important inspiration for the show. He coined the term "[[mobile suit]]" for the show's mecha as a reference to the novel's "[[mobile infantry]]". 

The show is notable for helping to create the "Real Robot":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha_anime_and_manga#Real_robot genre of piloted mecha and has spanned a very successful franchise lasting over 40 years.

This tag is for the 1979 TV series and related media, such as the compilation movie trilogy from the early 1980s, only. For the franchise as a whole, use the [[Gundam]] tag.

title: kirishima_yurika
body:
Secondary character from the [[Justice Gakuen]] series by [[Capcom]]. A musician specializing in the [[violin]], she is friends with [[Kazama Akira|Akira]] and [[Zaki (justice gakuen)|Zaki]] and is the older sister of [[Kirishima Kurow|Kurow]].

Yurika has [[long hair|long]] platinum [[blonde hair]] styled into [[twin drills|twin]] [[drill hair|drills]] and [[grey eyes]]. She wears an [[aqua dress]] with a white [[turtleneck]] and [[puffy short sleeves|puffy]] [[short sleeves]], [[red ribbon]]s on her [[neck ribbon|neck]] and [[back ribbon|back]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[white pantyhose|pantyhose]], and [[red shoes|red]] [[cross-laced shoes|cross-laced]] [[high heels]] with [[block heels]].

title: lumiose_city
body:
A location introduced in [[pokemon|Pokémon X and Y]]. It is the largest [[city]] in the Kalos region, and the site of [[Prism Tower]], which serves as the city's [[pokemon gym|Gym]]. [[Clemont (pokemon)|]] is the city's Gym Leader. [[pokemon legends: z-a|Pokémon Legends: Z-A]] is set entirely within the city.

Appears as a stage in multiple [[Super Smash Bros.]] games.

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Lumiose_City

title: kin'iro_ryotei_(umamusume)
body:
Anime-only [[Umamusume]] character. Background character with no voice lines. 

[[Horse girl]]. Has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] hair done up in a [[crown braid]] and a [[low ponytail]]. Also has [[green eyes]]. Does not have [[ear ornament]]s, but often depicted with [[cowlick]]s or her crown braid being more prominent and weighted towards her right ear.

Not directly based on an actual racehorse (as there is no racehorse called "Kin'iro Ryotei"), but her list of achievements and her name are unambiguously references to [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]]. In particular, during Stay Gold's stay in Hong Kong, his name was translated into Chinese as  “黄金旅程”. Translating 黄金旅程 into Japanese yields "Kin'iro Ryotei".

Despite being a background character, Kin'iro Ryotei has gained some popularity among fan artists, as her implied namesake is the father of the real-life [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]] (the racehorse). This had led to endless fodder for jokes depicting her together with [[Gold Ship (Umamusume)|]], [[Orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|]], and [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Stay Gold (umamusume)|]] - Official Umamusume Character

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Stay Gold (horse)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stay_Gold_(horse)]
* "Pixiv Dictionary: キンイロリョテイ(ウマ娘)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%AD%E3%83%B3%E3%82%A4%E3%83%AD%E3%83%AA%E3%83%A7%E3%83%86%E3%82%A4(%E3%82%A6%E3%83%9E%E5%A8%98)]

title: diving_suit
body:
A diving suit is a full-body suit designed to protect the wearer from exposure in an aquatic environment. Oftentimes it will incorporate some kind of breathing device, such as a [[snorkel]], [[diving helmet]], or [[diving regulator]], to allow the wearer to stay underwater for longer. There are several types of diving suits:
* [[Wetsuit]] (post #6373843)
* [[Dry Suit]] (post #5688866)
** [[Standard Diving Dress]] (post #2364603)

title: godolphin_barb_(umamusume)
body:
In [[Umamusume]], the Godolphin Barb refers both to one of the Three Goddesses of the [i]Umamusume[/i] universe as well as a training AI based on her, who is one of the hosts of the Grand Masters scenario. She represents "Love" and is represented by the color blue.

A [[horse girl]], she has [[long_hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[blue_jacket|blue]] [[track jacket]] and [[black shorts]] as well as [[ear covers]]. She has an [[ear ornament]] on her right ear.

She is based on the Godolphin Barb (or Arabian), one of the foundation sires of the Thoroughbred breed of horses. Her blue theme is likely based on the real Godolphin stable's royal blue racing silks. Through Matchem, he is the sire-line ancestor of about 1% of all Thoroughbreds. Even of all that, the overwhelming majority of living descendants are through Man O' War. In the context of [i]Umamusume[/i], he only has [[Calstone Light O (umamusume)|]] as a real-life descendant. Otherwise, [[Oguri Cap (umamusume)|]] would come the closest as the real horse's damsire (Silver Shark) is also of that sire-line.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6657513

h4. Related characters

* [[Darley Arabian (Umamusume)|]] - Fellow Goddess/Training AI
* [[Byerley Turk (Umamusume)|]] - Fellow Goddess/Training AI
other_names: ゴドルフィンバルブ(ウマ娘)

title: byerley_turk_(umamusume)
body:
In [[Umamusume]], the Byerley Turk refers both to one of the Three Goddesses of the [i]Umamusume[/i] universe as well as a training AI based on her, who is one of the hosts of the Grand Masters scenario. She represents "Discipline" and is represented by the color yellow.

A [[horse girl]], she has short brown and black two-toned hair as well as purple eyes. She wears a yellow military-style outfit and has a scar across her left eye. Overall, she somewhat resembles [[Symboli Rudolf (umamusume)|]] (and not by coincidence, as described below). She has a crown-like [[ear ornament]] on her right ear.

She is based on the Byerley Turk, one of the foundation sires of the Thoroughbred breed of horses. Her military theme is based on the fact that the real Byerley Turk was originally a war horse. Through Herod, he is the sire-line ancestor of about 4% of all Thoroughbreds. In the context of [i]Umamusume[/i], he is the real-life ancestor of only 6 characters: Those who are part of Partholon's sire-line ([[Symboli Rudolf (umamusume)|]], [[Tokai Teio (umamusume)|]], [[Tsurumaru Tsuyoshi (umamusume)|]], [[Samson Big (umamusume)|]] and [[Mejiro McQueen (umamusume)|]]) as well as [[Daitaku Helios (umamusume)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6657518

h4. Related characters

* [[Darley Arabian (Umamusume)|]] - Fellow Goddess/Training AI
* [[Godolphin Barb (Umamusume)|]] - Fellow Goddess/Training AI
other_names: バイアリーターク(ウマ娘)

title: amagi_(cv)_(azur_lane)
body:
The UR re-imagination of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Amagi (azur lane)|]] under a planned, but never realized aircraft carrier conversion. She is voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]]. 

She retains the same body and memories of the original Amagi but now pairs it with a new outfit and rigging. Her carrier-spec outfit consists of a [[black leotard]] and [[black pantyhose]] or a [[bodystocking]] worn under a [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]] and [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]], [[black gloves]], and black [[wide sleeves]]. Her new carrier [[rigging]] consists of two mechanical hull pieces with 120 mm twin gun mounts and a split [[flight deck]] materializing out of a [[phoenix]] familiar.

title: headdress
body:
An ornamental covering or band for the head, especially one worn on ceremonial occasions.

Use this tag for ornamental headdresses, such as the [[Native American headdress]]. Most headgear that can be described as "[[hairband]] but with lots of rigid(ish) decorations attached" or "hat/bonnet but truncated to only the middle 'band' part" are generally headdresses.

This tag can also be used as a fallback tag for ornamental headgear in general, but try to avoid using this tag for [[hat]]s, [[helmet]]s, [[hair ornament]]s, [[fake animal ears]] and simple [[ribbon]]s.

h4. See also

* [[maid headdress]]
* [[lolita hairband]]

title: gagharv_trilogy_mobile
body:
[i]The Legend of Heroes: Gagharv Trilogy[/i] is a mobile remake of [[Falcom|Nihon Falcom's]] third to fifth entries in the [[Eiyuu Densetsu]] series: [[Shiroki Majo]], [[Akai Shizuku]], and [[Umi no Oriuta]].

Developed by Korean game developer FOW Games, it aims to compile all three narratives into one chronologically followed story, while expanding on the trilogy's extensive lore through unseen stories to be approved by Falcom.

This was the second time the trilogy was released in English outside of Asian territories, preceded by the English localization of the PSP remakes by Microvision and Bandai Namco, released between 2005 to 2006.

First soft-launched in Australia, Canada, and Singapore in English on August 19, 2024, then fully launched for most countries on August 28 for Android, iOS, and PC, with Japanese and Traditional Chinese releases planned sometime in the future.

Use this tag for artworks that use the "modernized" redesigns of the Gagharv characters or anything that relates to the mobile game in general.

h4. External links

* "Official website":[https://legendofheroes-fow.com/]
* "Twitter account":[https://twitter.com/LoHGagharv_JP/]
* "Korean Naver Café":[https://cafe.naver.com/legendofheroesm/]

title: crazy_keiba_lady_(jra)
body:
A character appearing on a [[Japan Racing Association]] commercial promoting their merch mail-order website, [i]Turfy Mail Order Club[/i].

The Crazy Keiba Lady has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]] hair with [[swept bangs|bangs sweeping]] to the left. She has turquoise [[green eyes]] and wears a [[green sweater|green]] [[striped sweater|striped]] sweater and a [[yellow bag|yellow]] [[backpack]]. She is often seen carrying [[stuffed horse|horse plushies]] and other racehorse-related merchandise, and wears a [[animal hood|horse hood]] to bed.

As her name implies, the Crazy Keiba Lady is an avid fan of racehorse-related merch. Her favorite plush appears to be one of the racehorse [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]]. The Keiba Lady's catchphrase is "As someone who likes racehorses...", the first line she utters in the JRA commercial.

Because of her overenthusiastic passion for all things keiba (racehorses), as well as her blank-looking expression throughout the commercial, the Keiba Lady is known as the "Yabee Onna" or "Crazy Dangerous Woman" among the Japanese racehorse community. Fanart of her often portray her as a crazy overenthusiastic fan of [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]], and this has carried on over to his [[Orfevre (Umamusume)|Umamusume counterpart]] as well, especially in the [[Umamusume Tanuki]] series of fan videos. In fact, a character [[art_shift|art shifted]] to resemble her signifies that they have a similar love or obsession towards another character or subject, whatever it is in context.

Official merch of the Keiba Lady is also sold, and can be found under the "As Someone Who Likes Racehorses" label.

h4. Related characters

* [[Orfevre (racehorse)]]
* [[Orfevre (Umamusume)]]
* [[Orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|]]

h4. External Links

* "Youtube: Turfy Mail Order Club commercial":[https://youtu.be/NSr34vHNKYQ]
* "Youtube: Umamusume Tanuki parody of the above":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=82pwPaNngSs]

title: tech_3_ship_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]].

Tech 3 ships are constructed with Sleeper components that can only be found in Wormhole space. There are two classes of Tech 3 ships currently in the game:

* [[Tactical Destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s are very versatile [[destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s which can switch between different "modes" on the fly. T3 destroyers have generally lower skill requirements than T2 destroyers, as they serve as standard combat ships rather than filling special roles.
* [[Strategic Cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s are the most flexible and among the most powerful ships in the game for their size (and mass), with enormous possible variations in their capabilities, due to their ability to be fitted with one of three subsystems in four different slots. Flying strategic [[cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s requires training in these subsystem’s related skills, and may require a much wider range of other combat skills than [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|]]s.

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Tech and meta levels":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Tech_and_meta_levels#Tech_3

title: apocalypse_(eve_online)
body:
Class of a [[spacecraft]] in [[EVE Online]].

The Apocalypse (or "Apoc") is a Tech 1 [[Amarr Empire (EVE Online)|Amarr]] [[Attack ship (EVE Online)|Attack]] [[Battleship (EVE Online)|]]. It is the ultimate entry in the Amarr line of sniping laserboats after the Tormentor, [[Coercer (EVE Online)|]], [[Omen (EVE Online)|]], and [[Harbinger (EVE Online)|]]. It has bonuses to large energy [[turret]] optimal range and tracking speed. Together with the ability of energy turrets to switch crystals instantly, these bonuses make it perform well at different engagement ranges. Pulse [[laser]] Apocalypses with Tech 2 Scorch ammunition are able to deliver good damage at a decent distance. Apocalypses are also well suited to beam laser long-range fits.

Derivative classes: 

* Apocalypse Imperial Issue ([[Special Edition ship (EVE Online)|Special Edition version]])
* Apocalypse Navy Issue ([[Imperial Navy (EVE Online)|]] modification)
* [[Paladin (EVE Online)|]] ([[Marauder (EVE Online)|]])

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Apocalypse":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Apocalypse

title: destroyer_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]]. Destructive, albeit fragile craft meant as anti-frigate platforms.

Destroyers are larger ships than [[frigate (EVE Online)|]]s, but they still mount the same small-sized modules that frigates use. The Tech 1 destroyers have a large number of high slots, giving them a lot of firepower for their size and cost and making them good at salvaging. The [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 2]] destroyers have unique abilities: [[Interdictor]]s can launch warp disruption probes in nullsec and wormholes to prevent groups of enemy ships from warping away, and Command Destroyers can provide link boosts and utilize Micro Jump Field Generators to move nearby ships 100 km away. [[Tactical destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s, the [[Tech 3 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 3]] destroyers, have exceptional flexibility and firepower.

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Destroyers":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Destroyers

title: cow_print_bikini
body: A [[bikini]] that has a [[cow print]] pattern.

title: frigate_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]]. Small, fast but fragile vessels suited to a variety of purposes, especially tackling.

Frigates are the smallest and fastest ships in EVE. New pilots begin by flying frigates, and the Tech 1 frigates only cost a few hundred thousand ISK. Don't be fooled by the low cost of frigates and the fact that they're used by novice pilots, though: frigates can play an important role in battle, and in numbers or with skilled pilots even Tech 1 frigates can be deadly.

There are a number of classes of [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 2]] frigates, which have advanced abilities and are also much more focused on a particular role: tackling [[interceptor (EVE Online)|]]s, cloaking and scanning covert ops frigates, surprise-attack stealth bombers, [[electronic warfare ship (EVE Online)|electronic attack]] frigates for electronic warfare, and [[Assault ship (EVE Online)|assault]] frigates, which are designed purely to deal and survive damage.

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Frigates":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Frigates

title: gallente_federation_(eve_online)
body:
One of the four major factions in [[EVE Online]].

Champions of liberty and fierce guardians of the human spirit, the Gallente Federation is the only true democracy in New Eden. Its principles are brotherhood, fraternity, and equal rights to all men. Some of the most progressive leaders, scientists, and businessmen of the era have emerged from its diverse peoples. Pioneers of artificial intelligence, the Federation once relied almost entirely on [[drone]] fleets to defend its beliefs and borders. But the limitations of this technology and the lack of a human element—both in terms of a military strategy and as a means of spreading influence— eventually reached a critical point.

Rely on hybrid [[turret]]s, backed up by [[combat drone (EVE Online)|]]s. Balance armor with speed.

Gallente [[spacecraft|spaceship]]s usually have rounded shapes and dark green color.

h4. List of Gallente spaceships

h6. [[Frigate (EVE Online)|]]s

* [[Comet (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Incursus (EVE Online)|]]

title: minmatar_republic_(eve_online)
body:
One of the four major factions in [[EVE Online]].

The Minmatar Republic is one of the four empire factions in New Eden. It is a relatively young nation, born from enslavement and rebellion. Ships designed and produced by the Republic are noted for their speed and flexibility.

Prefer Projectile [[Turret]]s. Balance [[energy barrier|shields]] and armor with speed.

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Minmatar Republic":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Minmatar_Republic

title: cruiser_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]]. Craft with balanced offensive, defensive and mobility capabilities making them quite versatile.

Cruisers are EVE's medium-sized ships, larger than [[frigate (EVE Online)|]]s and [[destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s but still much smaller, faster, and nimbler than [[battlecruiser (EVE Online)|]]s and [[battleship (EVE Online)|]]s. Cruisers mount medium-sized weapons and modules. Tech 1 cruiser hulls cost around 10 million ISK and tend to be the first major financial step up from frigates for new pilots.

There are four classes of [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 2]] cruisers, which are more powerful, more focused on a particular role, and much more expensive than their Tech 1 equivalents:

* [[Recon Ship (EVE Online)|Recons]]: advanced force-multiplying [[Electronic Warfare ship (EVE Online)|]]s
* Heavy [[Assault ship (EVE Online)|Assault]] Cruisers: powerful damage-dealers
* Heavy [[Interdictor (EVE Online)|Interdiction]] Cruisers: super-tacklers
* Logistics cruisers: remote repair platforms

Cruisers and destroyers are the only ship classes that currently have a [[Tech 3 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 3]] version, the [[Strategic Cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s and [[Tactical Destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s.

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Cruisers":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Cruisers

title: corvette_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]]. Starting ships given free of charge, suitable for interstellar travel.

Little more than slower, armed shuttles, corvettes (formerly known as "rookies", "rookie ships" or "noobships") are the basic ships that new pilots start with. While corvettes aren't suited for serious combat, people field fleets composed entirely of corvettes, more for their comedy value than for their effectiveness in battle.

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Corvettes":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Corvettes

title: battlecruiser_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]]. A flexible fitting vessel that bridges the gap between [[cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s and [[battleship (EVE Online)|]]s.

Battlecruisers are larger, slower and have more slots than cruisers, but they're smaller than battleships and fit the same medium-sized weapons that cruisers use. They occupy a position between cruisers and battleships analogous to [[destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s' position between [[frigate (EVE Online)|]]s and cruisers, although battlecruisers are much more versatile and widely-used than destroyers. Most battlecruisers can mount Command Bursts, modules capable of giving significant bonuses to nearby allied ships. Tech 1 battlecruisers are the least character-skill-intensive and most accessible hull with this ability.

One group of [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|]]s, Command Ships, are based on battlecruiser hulls. Command Ships are more durable and dangerous versions of their Tech 1 base hulls, with space for more Command Bursts and bonuses to either the strength or the range of their bursts.

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Battlecruisers":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Battlecruisers

title: tech_2_ship_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]].

These ships are only manufactured by players through the Invention process. They are usually comparable in price to [[Navy faction (EVE Online)|]] ships while being more powerful, but have high skill requirements to use. As well as better performance and bonuses, T2 ships have increased damage resistance, making them tougher. Additionally, many (but not all) Tech 2 ships are more specialised than their Tech 1 counterparts. An example of a Tech 2 frigate is the Wolf, a Tech 2 [[Minmatar Republic (EVE Online)|Minmatar]] [[Assault ship (EVE Online)|Assault]] [[frigate (EVE Online)|]] based on the [[Rifter (EVE Online)|]].

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Tech and meta levels":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Tech_and_meta_levels#Tech_2_3

title: strategic_cruiser_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]]. Versatile ships that can be reconfigured for a variety of [[Attack ship (EVE Online)|attack]], [[Combat ship (EVE Online)|combat]], disruption or support roles.

Strategic cruisers (also T3Cs) are the [[Tech 3 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 3]] variant of the [[cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s. They are the evolution of Sleeper technology into the currently known technology base. In practical terms, they are expensive, powerful, and extremely customizable cruiser-sized ships.

It takes a lot of effort to build a strategic cruiser, and they consequently cost a lot. Most primary components of Tech 3 production are found in Wormholes, and some of the rarer gases and components are not available outside of Dangerous or Deadly Unknown systems.

The following are the strategic cruisers, by race:

* [[Amarr Empire (EVE Online)|]] [[Legion (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Caldari State (EVE Online)|]] [[Tengu (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Gallente Federation (EVE Online)|]] [[Proteus (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Minmatar Republic (EVE Online)|]] [[Loki (EVE Online)|]]

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Strategic Cruisers":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Strategic_Cruisers

title: twelve_forever
body:
An American animated cartoon series. It premiered on [[Netflix]] in 2019 and ran for one season before going on an indefinite hiatus. A pilot for the show was aired on [[Cartoon Network]] in 2015.

The series is about a young girl named [[Reggie Abbott]] who wants to be able to remain a child forever and is able to transport herself to a magical world where she never has to grow up.

title: ear_ornament
body:
An accessory worn on the ear, usually an [[animal ears|animal ear]]. Usually this is an [[ear bow]], [[ear ribbon]], or other similar ornament tied around the ear.

Ear ornaments are normally for [[animal ears]], not human ears. This should not be used for [[earrings]], [[earclip]]s, [[ear piercing]]s, or other jewelry or standard accessories worn on human ears.

[[Umamusume]] characters often feature these accessories as their "eardecs" feature prominently as part of their character designs. An ornament on the right ear indicates a character is based on a male horse, while an ornament on the left ear indicates a character is based on a female horse.

h4. Examples

* !post #9651884: [[Ear bow]]
* !post #3749339: [[Ear ribbon]]
* !post #4456171: [[Ear covers]]

h4. See also

* [[animal ear piercing]]
* [[ear bow]]
* [[ear ribbon]]
* [[ear covers]]

title: levitation

title: fangs
body:
For images of characters featuring multiple prominent canine teeth, such as with [[vampire|vampires]] or various animals.

Distinct from [[fang]], which refers to a single visible prominent canine tooth. This is a visual trait often meant to emphasize a specific aspect of a character's personality.

Distinct from [[sharp teeth]], where [b]all[/b] of a character's teeth are sharp--although it is possible for a character to have both, if the canines are noticeably larger than the rest.

Opposite of [[tusks]] which are typically larger lower teeth, usually on [[orc]]s or [[mammoth]]s.

h4. See also

* [[fangs out]]
* [[skin fangs]]

title: kamikura_yasuo
body: A character in [[Unnatural (series)|]]. He is portrayed by [[Matsushige Yutaka]].

title: ulrich_von_hutten_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Ulrich von Hutten[/i]. Character design by [[Ohisashiburi]], voiced by [[Yamamura Hibiku (voice Actor)|]]. 

She is a personification of one of the H-39 proposals, much like [[Friedrich der Grosse (azur lane)|]], though she seems to have more of a "younger sister" look. She has [[black hair]] with [[yellow eyes]] with a pair of red [[horns]]. Her legs are clad in [[black thighhighs]] while she appears to be wearing a black [[jacket]]. Her [[rigging]], much like other experimental Ironblood capital ships, is massive and has a deeply animalistic aesthetic. She also exhibits a cynical personality compared to the more nurturing Friedrich.

h4. Skins

* !post #5018432: Default
* !post #5018438: [[ulrich von hutten (mayhem maid) (azur lane)|Mayhem Maid]]
* !post #6724601: [[ulrich von hutten (ignition matrician) (azur lane)|Ignition Matrician]]
* !post #8465285: [[ulrich von hutten (what comes after the bell) (azur lane)|What comes after the Bell]]

title: lysandre_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lysandre[/b], known as [b]Fuladari[/b] (フラダリ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]][/i].

A well-known researcher and the boss of [[Team Flare]], Lysandre despairs at ugly conflicts in the world. His goal is to create a world where only the chosen ones remain.

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[orange hair]] with a [[beard]]. He wears a [[fur-trimmed jacket]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[ring]], [[pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: inkling
body:
A species of humanoid cephalopods in the [[Splatoon (series)|]] series that can transform into [[inkling_(swim_form)|squids]] and back to their humanoid form at will.

Use this species tag for any of the following characters, as long as they aren't depicted as an [[alternate species]] (e.g. a full-on human / [[humanization]]):

h4. Characters

* [b][[Inkling player character]][/b]
** [[Inkling Girl]]
** [[Inkling Boy]]
* [b]Idols[/b]
** [[Callie (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Marie (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Pearl (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Frye (Splatoon)|]]
* [b][[Squidbeak Splatoon]] (story mode cast)[/b]
** Agent 1 (Callie)
** Agent 2 (Marie)
** [[Agent 3 (Splatoon)|]], player character for Splatoon 1's hero mode.
** [[Agent 4 (Splatoon)|]], player character for Splatoon 2's hero mode.
** [[Agent 3 (Splatoon 3)|New Agent 3]], player character for Splatoon 3's hero mode. Can also be an [[Octoling]].
** [[Cap'n Cuttlefish]]
* [b]Promotional Material Inklings[/b]
** [[Kaori (splatoon)|]] 
** [[John (splatoon)|]] 
** [[Mizuho (splatoon)|]]
** [[Rui (splatoon)|]]
** [[Laura (splatoon)|]] 
** [[Pit_(splatoon)|]] 
** [[Surume (Splatoon)|]] 
** [[Cuttlefrsh (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Veronika (Splatoon)|]] 
** [[Anemoneno1 (Splatoon)|]] 
* [b]Other Inklings[/b] (WIP)
** [[Ichiya (splatoon)|]]
** [[Nami (splatoon)|]]
** [[Quinn (splatoon)|]]
** [[Clash (splatoon)|]]
** [[Jessika (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Yoko (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Baker (splatoon)|]]

** [[Lionel (splatoon)|]]


[b]Identifying [[Inkling]]s (as opposed to [[Octoling]]s)[/b]

Inklings have a few key traits that Octolings don't:
* [[pointy ears]]
* a black mask-like line that connects their eyes
* their [[suction cups]] appear within the [i]inside[/i] of their [[tentacle hair]] (e.g. post #6122993)
* sometimes depicted with [[star-shaped pupils]] (e.g. post #7316406)
** (the named Inklings, particularly the Idols, are nearly always depicted with them)
* unique hairstyles, see "this list of them (Splatoon wiki).":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Player_Settings#Inkling]
** [[Inkling girl]]s have some longer hairstyle options than [[Octoling girl]]s

post #7190600 is a good comparison of these traits, with an Inkling on the left and an Octoling on the right

Typical tags common to both Inklings and Octolings include [[tentacle hair]] and [[thick eyebrows]].

Note: Inklings do not usually have [[cephalopod eyes]] despite being based off Squid. Splatoon reserves those for Octolings, particularly the named Idol Octolings. post #4589127 is a very rare example of an Inkling drawn with cephalopod eyes

title: johnny_storm
body:
Johnathan Storm, also known as the [[Human Torch]], is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writer [[Stan Lee]] and artist Jack Kirby, Johnny first appeared in [i]The Fantastic Four[/i] #1 (Nov. 1961) and was a reincarnation of the [[android]] Human Torch, also known as [[Jim Hammond]], who was created in 1939 by Carl Burgos for Timely Comics.

A founding member of the [[Fantastic Four]], he received his powers after being exposed to high levels of radiation in [[space]]. After their mother, Mary, died in a [[car crash]] and their father, Dr. Franklin Storm, being sent to [[prison]] for accidently killing a person, Johnny and his older sister [[Sue Storm|Sue]] went to live with their aunt, who ran a boarding house. There Sue would meet and fall in love with [[Reed Richards]], who was working on an experimental [[rocket ship]] called Marvel-1. After the government cut it's funding, Reed decided to take it to space, along with Sue, Johnny and pilot [[Ben Grimm]]. In space, they were hit by a cosmic storm, exposing each of them to cosmic radiation and sent them crashing back down to [[Earth (planet)|]]. The experience gave each of them superhuman abilities and they decided to become the Fantastic Four. 

After being hit by the cosmic radiation, Johnny and his friends were mutated, allowing him to control heat energy and transform his body into a fiery [[plasma]]. He can generate and [[pyrokinesis|control]] [[fire]] from his body and can also [[flying|fly]] when aflame, capable of reaching supersonic speeds. Johnny has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]] and usually wears a [[two-tone bodysuit|two-tone]] [[blue bodysuit|blue]] and [[black bodysuit]] with the Fantastic Four logo on it.

Johnny is portrayed by [[Chris Evans]] in the 2005 film [[Fantastic Four (2005)|]] and its 2007 sequel, Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer (as well as [[Deadpool & Wolverine]]), Michael B. Jordan in the 2015 film [[Fantastic Four (2015)|]], and Joseph Quinn in the [[Marvel]] film [[The Fantastic Four: First Steps]]. He has also appeared in various other Marvel-releated media like TV shows and video games, including [[Marvel Future Fight]] and [[Marvel Rivals]].

h4. Appearance

title: artoria_caster_(fate)
body:
Caster-class variant of [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]], introduced during the [[Fate/Grand Order]] 5th Anniversary event. First debuted in the second opening of [i]Cosmos in the Lostbelt[/i] and is a major character in [i][[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|Lostbelt no. 6: Avalon le Fae]][/i].

She is an alternate version of Artoria who was chosen by the [[Staff of Selection (fate)|]] instead of the Sword of Selection, leading her to study magic instead of becoming a knight. Notably, she does not bear the Pendragon name, unlike her selves from Proper Human History. [spoiler]This is because Artoria Caster is completely unrelated to the Artoria from Proper Human History; she was created explicitly to fulfill the prophecy of Faerie Britain and destroy the Lostbelt, a mission originally assigned to [[Aesc (fate)|Lostbelt]] [[Morgan le Fay (Fate)|Morgan]] that she abandoned.[/spoiler] Her third ascension is also known as [b]Artoria Avalon[/b].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]
