title: original
body:
Artwork depicting a subject that isn't from any established [[howto:copyright|copyright]]. Basically, art that is not fanart.

Some art may depict original subjects alongside subjects from an established copyright, or a fan-made character of a specific copyright. In this case, the art should be tagged as original and with the tag for the copyright and apply the tag [[oc x canon]].

If the artwork shows a [i]different artist's[/i] original character, include the [[borrowed character]] tag as well.

Some works on Pixiv are occasionally tagged original by accident. Art by the character designer for an established copyright also sometimes tag their work as original — on Danbooru, these should be tagged with the corresponding copyright instead.

h4. See also

* [[adoptable]]
* [[borrowed character]]
* [[commissioner insert]]
* [[copyright request]]

title: azur_lane
body:
[b]Azur Lane[/b] is a Chinese shipgirl-themed side-scrolling shoot 'em up mobile game developed by Shanghai Manjuu and Xiamen Yongshi and published by [[Yostar]].

h4. Gameplay

Like [[Kantai Collection]], the game is set during World War II and mainly features collecting and controlling moe [[personification]]s of [[warship]]s from major participants of [[World War II]]. Unlike [[Kantai Collection]], it features side-scrolling shooter gameplay with mechanics akin to those of [[Touhou]]. Other gameplay elements, such as customization of a interactive backyard and marrying in-game characters, are also present. The real life factions are replaced by fictional counterparts (such as Empire of Japan being called as "Sakura Empire", United States as "Eagle Union", etc.)

Unlike KanColle, the game has made an effort to distance itself from WW2 in most aspects in order to appeal to a broader audience, pushing for most fantastical designs, the implementation of collabs unrelated to WW2 naval history, the release of shipgirls based on fictional warships without proper historical precedent, post-war era warships, WW1 warships, dark versions of its existing shipgirls (METAships), shipgirls from the Age of Sail, child and idol variants of its characters, and so on.

h4. Media

The game has been adapted into several manga and novelizations. [[Azur Lane: Crosswave]], a [[PlayStation 4]] / PC game, was released in 2019. A TV anime adaptation aired during Fall 2019. The game has also held an annual collaboration with [[World of Warships]] since 2017. [[Azur Lane: Slow Ahead]], a slice-of-life [[4koma]] series, was adapted into an anime in early 2021.

h4. History

[i]Azur Lane[/i] was launched on May 25th, 2017 in China, on September 14th, 2017 in Japan, on March 27th, 2018 in Korea, on August 16th, 2018 in English, and around September 2019 in Taiwan. As of 2024, the number of players registered surpassed at least 41 million.

h4. Tagging

Don't tag shipgirls with [[mecha musume]], [[personification]],  [[World War II]], or [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], unless these things are present outside of the shipgirls themselves.

Shipgirls of the same class may be tagged as [[sisters]], see forum #239409 and topic #24859.

title: darley_arabian_(umamusume)
body:
In [[Umamusume]], the Darley Arabian refers both to one of the Three Goddesses of the [i]Umamusume[/i] universe as well as a training AI based on her, who is one of the hosts of the Grand Masters scenario. She represents "Bravery" and is represented by the color red.

A [[horse girl]], she has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] with a [[white streaks|white streak]] marking as well as [[green eyes]]. She has distinctively [[dark skin]] and wears a summer casual outfit baring her shoulders. She has an [[ear ornament]] on her right ear.

She is based on the Darley Arabian, one of the foundation sires of the Thoroughbred breed of horses. Through Eclipse, he is the sire-line ancestor of 95% of all Thoroughbreds. In the context of [i]Umamusume[/i], he is the real-life sire-line ancestor of the vast majority of the cast.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6657507

h4. Related characters

* [[Byerley Turk (Umamusume)|]] - Fellow Goddess/Training AI
* [[Godolphin Barb (Umamusume)|]] - Fellow Goddess/Training AI

title: sakura_laurel_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

A positive-thinking [[horse girl]] with a sunny disposition. Although she is sickly by nature and injury-prone due to her fragile legs, she always came back from her setbacks and never gets discouraged. She has a peculiar rivalry with [[Narita Brian (Umamusume)|]]. She also dreams of winning the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe, becoming a francophile as a result.

Before she was made playable and had her characterization settled, she was usually portrayed in fan-art as a [[yandere]] rival to Narita Brian.

Laurel has her own spin-off manga titled [[Umamusume: Star Blossom]].

title: belno_light_(umamusume)
body:
Major supporting character from [[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]]. [[Oguri Cap (Umamusume)|]]'s classmate at the Kasamatsu branch of [[Tracen Academy]] from the Cinderella Gray manga continuity.

[[Horse girl]]. Has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|brown]] hair with a [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streak]] on the front. She also has [[yellow eyes]] and wears two "B" [[letter hair ornament]]s, plus a red cord ribbon tied around her left ear.

Belno is not directly named after a real-life horse, though her name and "twin B" hair ornaments are veiled references to Twin Bee, a racing mare and contemporary of the real life [[Oguri Cap (racehorse)|]]. Twin Bee was named after the first [[Twinbee]] video game, which features [b]Bells[/b] (pronounced roughly the same as "Ber" and spelled the same in katakana) as the main in-game powerup item and has a protagonist named [[Light (Twinbee)|]].

title: kashino_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Japanese munition ship [i]Kashino[/i] in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i].
Character designed by [[YYY (zelda10010)|]], voiced by [[Kondou Reina]]. 

Her default outfit consist of [[white dress| white]] [[military uniform]] with a [[miniskirt| short]] [[purple skirt| purple]] [[pleated skirt]] and a [[black thighhighs]].

Her physical appearance includes [[long hair| long]], [[brown hair]], appearing like a [[cow girl]] with [[cow ears]], [[cow horns]] and a [[cow tail]]. Her best features are her [[huge breasts]], rivaling those of [[Taihou (Azur Lane)|]], [[Sirius (Azur Lane)|]] and [[Zara (Azur Lane)|]].

title: pururut
body:
One of the main heroines of [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V]], known as [b]Plutia[/b] in English localizations.

She is the CPU of the Megadimension Planeptune. [[Personification]] of the prototype [[Sega]] Pluto video game system. While she seems carefree and airheaded most of the time with a light hint of [[sadism]], her CPU-form [[Iris Heart (neptunia)|]] takes that sadism to the max.

Voiced by: [[Hanazawa Kana]] (Japanese), [[Cherami Leigh]] (English)

h4. See also

* [[Iris Heart (neptunia)|]], her HDD form

title: neptune_(series)
body:
The Neptunia series is a series of games developed by [[Idea Factory]] and published by [[Compile Heart]].

The story is loosely based on the console wars and takes place in the world of Gamindustri (corrupted from [i]Game Industry[/i]) which is divided in multiple regions, each represented by a goddess which is the [[personification]] of a game console from major (and former) game console developer company. Also presenting personification of (mostly Japanese) game companies and some famous games.

Character designs were done by [[tsunako]].

h4. List of games

h5. Main

* [[Choujigen Game Neptune|Hyperdimension Neptunia]] (2010)
* [[Choujigen Game Neptune mk2|Hyperdimension Neptunia mk2]] (2011)
* [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V|Hyperdimension Neptunia Victory]] (2012)
* [[Shin Jigen Game Neptune VII|Megadimension Neptunia VII]] (2015)
Remakes of the first three games in the series known as [b]Re;Birth[/b] were released for the PS Vita and later for PC via Steam. They mostly follow the storylines of original titles.

h5. Spinoffs

* [[kami jigen idol neptune pp|Hyperdimension Neptunia: Producing Perfection]] (2013)
* [[chou megami shinkou noire gekishin black heart|Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart]] (2014)
* [[choujigen action neptune u|Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed]] (2014)
* [[gekijigen tag: blanc + neptune vs zombie gundan|MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune vs Zombies]] (2015)
* [[choujigen taisen neptune vs sega hard girls|Superdimension Neptune VS Sega Hard Girls]] (2015)
* [[Four Goddesses Online: Cyber Dimension Neptune]] (2017)
* [[Brave Neptune|Super Neptunia RPG]] (2018)
* [[VVVtune|Neptunia Virtual Stars]] (2020)
* [[senran nin nin ninja taisen neptune: shoujo-tachi no kyouen|Neptunia x Senran Kagura: Ninja Wars]] (2021)
* [[Choujigen Game Neptune Sisters vs Sisters]] (2022)

h4. Characters

h6. Goddesses/CPUs

title: kami_jigen_game_neptune_v
body:
The third game of the [[Neptune (series)|Neptune series]], a role-playing game published for the [[PlayStation 3]] by [[COMPILE HEART]] Inc. in 2010.

Sequel of the [[Choujigen Game Neptune mk2|Hyperdimension Neptunia mk2]].

Released in English as [b]Hyperdimension Neptunia Victory[/b](emphasis on the "[b]V[/b]").

A full remake of the game titled [b]Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth3: V Generation[/b] was developed by Felistella and released for [[Playstation Vita]] and Microsoft Windows (Steam) in 2015.

title: iris_heart_(neptunia)
body:
The CPU persona of [[Pururut]]. Has a [[dominatrix|dominating]] and [[sadism|sadistic]] nature, which leads to her torturing her enemies (and sometimes, her allies as well).

h4. See also
* [[Pururut]]
* [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V]]

title: neptune_(neptunia)
body:
The main character of [[Choujigen Game Neptune]], and of most games thereafter in the [[neptune (series)|Neptunia series]].

While depicted as a preteen girl without a single care in the world, Neptune is actually one of the four goddesses of Gamindustri, presiding over the Land of Purple Progress, Planeptune. After losing a fight with the other three goddesses in the world of Celestia, she is banished to the earth below, driving into the ground headfirst and losing her memories.

Her regular appearance consists of a [[hoodie]]/[[hooded jacket]] with [[drawstring]]s that resemble [[usb]] controller plugs, blue-and-white [[striped thighhighs]], and [[D-pad hair ornament]]s. Both her [[purple_eyes|eyes]] and [[short_hair|short]], rather messy [[purple_hair|hair]] are purple.

While many of the characters of the franchise tend to break the [[fourth wall]] on occasion, Neptune is the one who does so most frequently.

Choujigen Game Neptune's characters are mainly personifications of game companies or game consoles, Neptune represents the long-canceled [[Sega]] Neptune.

Voiced by: [[Tanaka Rie]] (Japanese), [[Melissa Fahn]] (English)

h4. Appearance

* !post #5127758

h4. See also

* [[Purple Heart (neptunia)|]], Neptune's HDD (Hard Drive Divinity) form
* [[Next Purple]], Neptune's NEXT Form
* [[Adult Neptune]], older Neptune from the Zero Dimension

title: captain_majima
body:

title: majima_goro
body:
A recurring character in the [[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]] series. He appears as a playable character in [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 0]] and [[Ryuu ga Gotoku of The End]].

As a [[yakuza]], Majima is a ferocious and unpredictable man; his infamous antics has resulted in people fearing him as "Mad Dog of Shimano." He is [[Saejima Taiga]]'s oath brother and is a frenemy to [[Kiryu Kazuma]].

Majima has a lean build, [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and a [[goatee]]. He wears an [[eyepatch]] with a snake pattern over his missing left eye. He is commonly depicted wearing an [[open clothes|open]] [[snake print|snakeskin]] blazer, a [[gold necklace]], [[black pants|black leather pants]] and [[black footwear|black steel-toed snakeskin shoes]]. His [[irezumi]] is a [[hannya]] surrounded by [[flower|flowers]] with two [[snake|snakes]] surrounding his arms.

Voiced by [[Ugaki Hidenari]] (Japanese), [[Mark Hamill]] (English, [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 1]]), and [[Matthew Mercer]] (English, [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 7]]).

h4. Appearance

* !post #4881128
* !post #5337616: [[Goromi]]
* !post #9034016: [[Captain Majima]]

h4. See also

* [[Majima everywhere]]

title: goromi
body:
[[Majima Goro]]'s [[crossdressing]]-hostess persona, first introduced in [[Ryuu Ga Gotoku Kiwami]].

Wears a [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[wig]] tied into a [[short hair|short]] [[updo]], decorated with a [[pink flower|pink]] [[hair flower|flower]] or [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|bow]]; a pair of [[earrings]], an [[eyepatch]], a [[necklace]], a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[bodycon]] [[dress]] with a [[snakeskin]] [[print dress|print]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[fishnet thighhighs]] and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[pumps]].

Retains many of Majima's normal traits, such as his [[goatee]], [[irezumi]] and brash personality.

title: male_corrin_(fire_emblem)
body:
The male version of Corrin from [[Fire Emblem Fates]]. As an avatar character, Corrin's name, gender, appearance, and voice are customizable by the player.

He has [[short hair|short]], [[spiked hair]], [[red eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and [[bangs]] that drape over his forehead and slightly to the side. By default, he wears a silver [[cuirass]] with gray and black accents, as well as a [[collar]] with [[buckle]]s on the sides.

Supposedly born to Hoshidan royalty, Corrin was kidnapped at an early age and raised in Nohr. Carrying ancient dragon blood, they are able to tap the power of Dragon Veins to manipulate the territory around them. They are also able to turn into a [[dragon]], though they normally only do so involuntarily and out of insanity. As a result, Corrin keeps a [[dragonstone]] on their person to assume full control of their transforming powers.

His dragon form and gentle personality are strongly based on the [[qilin (mythology)|]], a chimerical creature that, in Chinese mythology, primarily symbolizes benevolence and fortune. It is said to foretell the birth or arrival of an illustrious ruler or great human being.

Voiced by [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]] in Japanese and "Cam Clarke":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cam_Clarke in English, with certain voice options in [[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]] voiced by [[Yuri Lowenthal]].

h4. Appearance

title: ninja_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that turns [[Kirby]] into a [[ninja]] capable of wielding a [[katana]] and throwing [[kunai]].

This form has varied throughout the years, but in its modern form, Kirby wears a [[purple cloak|purple]] [[cowl]] along with a [[blue headband]] that comes with a studded [[star print|star]]. In older games, Kirby wears a [[red headwear|red]] [[hat]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[ponytail]] sticking out, and in some cases, take on a [[purple skin|purple]] hue.

h4.Icon
!asset #32563985

title: drill_kirby
body: A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]] and [[Kirby's Dream Buffet]] which lets [[Kirby]] drill into the ground. When in this form, Kirby wear a [[brown helmet|brown]] [[two-tone helmet|and]] [[yellow helmet|yellow]] [[hard hat]] with a [[drill]] in its center and a clear [[assault visor]]. h4.Icon !asset #32563952 Evolved Forms * [[Pencil Drill Kirby]] * [[Twin Drill Kirby]]

title: sleep_kirby
body: A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that puts [[Kirby]] to [[sleeping|sleep]] when accquired. In this form, Kirby wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] or [[blue headwear|blue]] [[nightcap]] that comes decorated in [[polka dot headwear|polka dots]] and has a [[pom pom (clothes)|pom pom]] at its tip. h4.Icon !asset #32563818 Evolved Forms: * [[Deep Sleep Kirby]]

title: cats_love_being_spanked
body: A cat or cat-like character showing pleasure at being spanked/patted in the back. A common behavior among housecats.

title: gascogne_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the French battleship [i]Gascogne[/i], as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. Character design by [[Liduke]], voiced by [[Komatsu Mikako]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[yellow eyes]] and wears a plain [[white dress]] with a black stripe running down the centerline and [[black thighhighs]]. She brandishes a rather large [[cross (weapon)|]] as a melee weapon in addition to her guns. Her personality is robotic, referring to herself in the third-person while constantly verbalizing her actions and status (in addition to those of her allies and the Commander). 

As a reference to [[World of Warships]], from which she was taken as part of the collaboration between Azur Lane and Wargaming, one of her skills boosts her main battery reload.

The historical [i]Gascogne[/i] was a French battleship meant to be a member of the [i]Richelieu[/i]-class, except her main battery was arranged in an A-X layout (similar to [[Admiral Graf Spee (Azur Lane)|]] and her sisters). Before she could be formally ordered, France fell to Nazi Germany and the docks were occupied and looted by occupation forces.

h4. Appearance

title: foot_dangle
body:
[[Sitting]] with the feet hanging freely rather than being [[legs_up|raised up]] or resting on a solid surface.

It should be clear that the character's legs aren't long enough to reach the floor or ground.

If the character's feet are submerged in liquid, use [[soaking feet]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #4990966

h4. See also

* [[shoe dangle]]
* [[hanging legs]] for when a character is suspended

title: knees_together_feet_apart
body:
Legs that are held together at the [[knees]] but not at the [[feet]].

If their feet are pointed inward, they may also be [[pigeon-toed]].

Contrast with [[legs together]], which is when the legs are together along their entire length.

h4. Examples

* !post #6856061
* !post #7276302

h4. See also

* [[knees apart feet together]]
* [[legs together]]
* [[pigeon-toed]]
* [[wariza]]
* [[tag group:posture]]

title: legs_together
body:
Legs held together along their entire length, with no or minimal separation between them.

The legs may or may not be [[crossed_legs|crossed]], and it doesn't matter if the character is [[lying]], [[sitting]], or [[standing]]. A [[thigh gap]] may be present depending on the character's proportions. If the legs aren't fully visible, they should look like they would be together if they were visible along their entire length.

If the legs are touching at the knees not at the feet, use [[knees together feet apart]] instead.

Contrast with [[legs apart]] and [[spread legs]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6519103
* !post #3436445
* !post #7810249

h4. See also

* [[seiza]]
* [[yokozuwari]]
* [[knees together feet apart]]
* [[legs apart]]
* [[spread legs]]
* [[tag group:posture]]

title: pigeon-toed
body:
A stance where the toes point inwards when [[standing]], [[sitting]], or [[walking]]. Also called in-toeing, often caused by genu valgum, or "knock-knee".

Not to be confused with [[knees together feet apart]], also called "knock-knee". [[Pigeon-toed]] characters don't always have their knees together (but often do), while characters with knock-knees aren't always pigeon-toed.

h4. Examples

* !post #5089193
* !post #3297691: Normal vs. pigeon-toed

h4.  See also 

* [[knees together feet apart]]
* [[Tag group:Posture]]

title: d-day
body:
Technically a military designation of the date a given operation commences, [b]"D-Day"[/b] has come to be known as an alternate name for [b]Operation Neptune[/b] on 6 June 1944, the date Allied forces (US, UK, Canada and Free French) launched the [[invasion_of_normandy|invasion of the French region of Normandy]], code-named [b]Operation Overlord[/b], in [[World War II]].

h4. See also

* [[Juno Beach]]
* [[Omaha Beach]]
* [[Pointe du Hoc]]
other_names: オーヴァーロード作戦

title: invasion_of_normandy
body:
[b]The Invasion of Normandy[/b], also known as [b][[D-Day]][/b] or [b]Operation Overlord[/b], was an Allied operation that launched the successful invasion of [[germany|German]]-occupied Western Europe during [[World War II]]. 

The operation was launched on 6 June 1944 with the Normandy landings ([b]Operation Neptune[/b]). A 1,200-plane airborne assault preceded an amphibious assault involving more than 5,000 vessels. Nearly 160,000 troops crossed the English Channel on 6 June, and more than two million Allied troops were in [[France]] by the end of August 1944.

h4. See also
* [[Omaha Beach]]
* [[Juno Beach]]
* [[Battle of Carentan]]
* [[Battle of Caen]]
* [[Pointe du Hoc]]

* [[Saving Private Ryan]]
* [[Band of Brothers]]

* [[101st Airborne]]

* [[Battle of France]]
other_names: ノルマンディー上陸作戦

title: pointe_du_hoc
body:
A promontory with a cliff overlooking the English Channel on the northwestern coast of Normandy, [[France]]. During the [[World war ii|Second World War]], it was fortified by [[Germany]] with concrete bunkers and machine gun posts as part of the Atlantic Wall fortifications.

During [[D-Day]], it was the site of the [b]Battle of Pointe du Hoc[/b], where the [[United States Army Rangers]] attacked and scaled the cliff to capture the assumed location of an artillery battery that could hamper the main assault on the beaches, only to discover that the guns have been removed prior to the attack.

title: hanging_legs
body:
Legs dangling limply off the ground while a character is lifted or suspended in midair.

Often seen with [[lifting person]] and [[height difference]]. Used when legs are hanging. Feet must be off the ground.

* !post #5520440

* [[foot dangle]] for a sitting character with legs off the ground.

title: believe_(umamusume)
body:
A character from [[Umamusume]]. This [[tomboy]]ish [[horse girl]] has resolute faith to her skills as a runner, especially as a sprinter.

Aside from being a filly/left-ear, Believe stands out amongst her friends and rivals in the "Sprinter trio" simply by being down to earth compared to them, being the straight woman to [[Durandal (umamusume)|]]'s chivalry antics and [[Calstone Light O (umamusume)|]]'s single-track mind.

Voiced by [[Akiyama Misaki]].

title: god_eater
body:
A 2010 [[Bandai Namco]] game for the [[PlayStation Portable]], with a 2011 expanded version called "Gods Eater Burst" [sic] which was also the only version released outside of Japan.

By the year 2071, humanity was pushed to near-extinction by the [[Aragami]], omnivorous monsters mistaken for deities. In a struggle for survival, a group of humans, dubbed "God Eaters", were tasked with hunting them down using God Arcs, biomechanical weapons made from Oracle Cells (the same material which forms the Aragami) and controlled via Oracle Cells injected into their own bodies.

GOD EATER Character Design: 板倉耕一 (Itakura Kouichi) (General NPC characters like Amamiya Lindow etc., main graffics), 曽我部修司 (Sogabe Shuuji) (Protagonist and Fenrir school uniform design, public relations illustrations)

GOD EATER BURST Character Design: 小林くるみ (Kobayashi Kurumi) (Ren's design, sub character redesign of defense group etc., new player clothes design, first time priviledge premium clothes design, other illustrations)

h4. Games
* God Eater (2010) - PSP
* [[God Eater Burst]] (2011) - PSP
* God Eater 2 (2013) - PSP, PS Vita
* [[God Eater 2: Rage Burst]] (2015) - PS4, PS Vita, Windows
* [[God Eater Resurrection]] (2015) - PS4, PS Vita, Windows
* God Eater Online (2016) - iOS, Android
* [[God Eater Resonant Ops]] (2018) - iOS, Android
* [[God Eater 3]] (2018) - PS4, Nintendo Switch, Windows

h4. External links

* GOD EATER Official Site: http://www.godeater.jp/
* GOD EATER Project G.E. Koushiki Blog: http://ameblo.jp/project-ge/
* Wikipedia: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ゴッドイーター

title: momijimaru_(zorome_(kannazuki))
body:
66 Name: "Evil Demon" Hanamaru * *Age: 100 feet or 80 cm Gender: Male Ability Score: 5678910 Kamo // Citizen A demon, a monster of the mountains. It is not a human demon born from humans, but a type of nature spirit or demon born from the energy of all things in the universe. Its previous name was "Akihayama Shuten Doji." It only sees the living beings of this world as "enemies or food," and does not distinguish between humans and demons. It is very warlike. While wandering the country in search of an enemy worthy of a duel to the death, a crow cut off its left arm in the imperial capital, and it settled there to try to settle the score with it. Its personality is that of a ruffian. To put it bluntly, it is naive. If it wants to eat, it eats; if it wants to rape, it rapes. It kills anyone who gets in its way. [Teigen] "Demon" Momijimaru [Resident Registration]
I will be participating in the "Teito Gensotan" project. ★Status Notes: Name: "Momijimaru," Age: "1200," Height: "A little over 2 meters." ★(｀・ｗΦ)＜ He's a demon! Scary! ★A stereotypical demon. BL, injuries, gore, and bad endings are all welcome, but the only condition I will impose is "depiction of loss or murder." For other depictions, feel free to do as you like. ★[Loss] = Only those who reduce Momijimaru's demonic power by 3 or more with a critical attack. [Murder] = Only those who reduce Momijimaru's demonic power to 0. ★[2013/4 Ability Values] Initial demonic power: 10 Current demonic power: 10-3=7 Evil spirit: The scenery becomes distorted when you get close ★Links: Original project owner (illust/33027347) Borrowed materials (illust/4059234) (illust/12303437) (illust/10072152) ★Ranked 40th in the R-18 rankings as of March 24, 2013?゜･｡+★( ０ωΦ)+｡･゜Yay!...[In Combat] The scar on his left eye was gouged out in a battle with the "Demon-Eating Cat Demon" about a hundred years ago. It is said that he has carried a cat demon girl with him ever since. He is not a lolicon. He does not care about other youkai. He does not buy them unless they are sold to him, but once he does, he shows no mercy. He may meet any youkai that has lived over a hundred years. Akaban is furry and adorable. He has an almost loving attachment to the crow that cut off his left arm, but he is a true non-human who does not understand human emotions, so he is unaware of this. Kojimaru, in his normal state, wanders around the town. He never runs away or hides from the crow. [Demonic Sword - Momomaru] Momomaru: A Bakekatana formed from Momomaru's left horn. When slashed, autumn leaves fly everywhere. How beautiful! It cannot be used for cooking. [Normal] ・Kumadori makeup disappears ・Horns shrink ・Expression becomes (slightly) calmer. The arrangements are free, such as wearing a kimono that hides the scars on your face with your hair. The kimono basically has a maple leaf print, but black paint is fine too. It can also be elegant. After all, she is a demon.

title: dead_cells:_the_queen_and_the_sea
body:
The Queen and the Sea DLC is the third paid expansion for Dead Cells. It was released on the 6th of January 2022 to PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, and the Nintendo Switch, and on the 7th of April 2022 to iOS and Android. The expansion adds a new optional side route through the final section of the game, with new enemies and a new boss to fight, new outfits and gear to unlock, as well as a new ending.

This list contains all newly added content that is locked behind the DLC, it needs to be installed for this content to be found.

Contents
The expansion includes a total of three new biomes:

Infested Shipwreck
Lighthouse
The Crown
Two new enemies:

Armored Shrimp
Mutineer
Two new bosses:

The Servants
The Queen
10 new items:

Leghugger
Scavenged Bombard
Abyssal Trident
Hand Hook
Killing Deck
Maw of the Deep
Bladed Tonfas
Gilded Yumi
Wrecking Ball
Queen's Rapier
Two new keys:

Crowned Key
Forked Key
15 new outfits:

Armored Shrimp Carcass Outfit
Mutineer Outfit
Delayed Hedgehog Outfit
Servant Outfit
Toxic Servant Outfit
Silver Servant Outfit
Aurora Servant Outfit
King's Servant Outfit
Flawless Servant Outfit
Queen Outfit
White Gold Queen Outfit
Cherry Blossom Queen Outfit
Frozen Queen Outfit
Spicy Queen Outfit
Flawless Queen Outfit
And 17 new achievements:

Iceberg right ahead!
8th wonder
A sparkle in the night
Infiltration
Firefighter
Unwavering loyalty
Long live the Queen
Full house
On Her Majesty's Secret Service
Her Majesty
Lilibet
Black flag*
Spare!*
Plank walk*
Oh how fast they grow!
You're not my family*
Put that thing back where it came from or so help me

*Exclusive to PC and Nintendo Switch.

title: queen's_rapier_(dead_cells)
body:
Signature weapon of The Queen, an optional boss in the Dead Cells: The Queen and the Sea DLC. This weapon can be obtained after defeating her.
It's a rapier.

title: the_queen_(dead_cells)
body:
The Queen is an alternative final boss to the gane, Seas Cells. She resides in the Crown at the top of the Lighthouse. She is exclusive to the Queen and the Sea DLC.

Like the Beheaded, the Queen was turned into a homunculus with a "head" that has three marks resembling the King's coat of arms and a halo; compared to the Beheaded having just one mark

Her signature weapon is the "Queen's Rapier":[post #9989132], which is obtained after defeating her.

title: deadlift
body: A [[weightlifting]] exercise in which a [[barbell]] is lifted from the ground to the level of the hips. It is one of three movements known as the powerlifting exercises, alongside the [[squatting|squat]] and [[bench press]].

She was the commander of the Revolutionary Army's East Army and the mother of [[Jewelry Bonney]].

title: taiko_sticks
body: Long, cylindrical [[drumsticks]] used for [[playing instrument|playing]] [[taiko_drum|taiko drums]]. Called [i]bachi[/i] in Japanese, but not to be confused with the plectrum of a shamisen (see [[bachi]]).

title: cymbals
body:
A concave plate of brass or bronze that produces a sharp, ringing sound when struck. They are commonly played by being hand-held and clashed together or seen with [[drum set|drum sets]] being struck by [[drumsticks]].

h4. See also

* [[instrument]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: drum_set
body:
A collection of [[drum]]s and other percussion instruments such as [[cymbals]] arranged to be played by a single person. Also called a [b]drum kit[/b] or a [b]trap set[/b].

The most basic set is composed of two tom drums set atop a bass drum, a floor tom drum, a snare drum, a crash cymbal and a pair of hi-hat cymbals on a stand. Depending on the music genre in which the set is to be used, other kinds of drums and percussion instruments can supplement the basic set.

title: keytar
body:

The name is a portmanteau of the words "keyboard" and "[[guitar]]."

body:

title: juno_beach
body:
One of five beach landing sectors designated for the amphibious assault component of [[D-Day]] during [[World War II]], falling under the responsibility of primarily the [[Canadian_Armed_Forces|Canadian Army]].

Despite delays due to bad weather, and heavy resistance due to the pre-landing bombardment being less effective than anticipated, the Canadian Army managed to push the farthest inland than any other landing force on D-Day.

title: plunging_neckline
body:

This should not be used for garments that are closed above the breasts (though they may have laces to hold themselves together), and should only be used for [[unzipped]] or [[unbuttoned]] garments if they are consistently worn in this manner by an established character.

title: daring_tact_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Youmiya Hina]]. Japan's sixth Triple Tiara and the first to be unveiled in [i]Umamusume[/i].

With the 4th anniversary, she is revealed to be the nature uma, running for the sake of her hometown. As an aficionado of hiking in the wilds and mountain climbing (and thanks to certain bear-related incidents [[Daring Tact (racehorse)|her RL counterpart]] or [[Titleholder (racehorse)|other inferred natives of her hometown]] took part in or witnessed), many recent artworks present her as a wilderness survival expert and/or as someone who "plays" with [[bear]]s at a regular basis, but otherwise she is seen as a kind-hearted girl who is more well-adjusted than the other Triple Tiaras.

She is currently the youngest horse represented in the franchise (born April 15th 2017, replacing [[Satono Diamond (umamusume)|]], who was born January 30th 2013), and the first horse to be still active when first unveiled.

She would appear in Season 3 of the anime, appearing along with Team Rigel, presumably their newest recruit. She later made a cameo appearance in [[Mejiro Ramonu (umamusume)|]]'s campaign. It's only with the 4th anniversary update that she obtained a speaking role.

She is particularly deep in "the Dark Side of the Horse":[/pools/17253], being the real life descendant of five characters, several of those being important in the main stories.

h4. Appearance

The good doctor appears as a middle-aged man with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] hair and a constant no-nonsense, grim expression. He is drawn with noticeable East Asian facial features, contrasting with the rest of the cast's "mukokuseki" (anime "non-ethnic") artstyle.

The doctor wears a white tunic resembling a "Howie-style" labcoat with a [[mandarin collar]] and side buttons, but with [[short sleeves]] instead of long.

title: mejiro_family_matriarch
body:
Unnamed supporting character from the [[Umamusume]] anime. Head of the [[Mejiro Family (umamusume)|]] and presumptive grandmother of [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|]].

The Mejiro matriarch appears as an [[old woman|elderly woman]] with [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[light purple hair|light purple]] hair (same shade as [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|McQueen]]'s). She wears a wide-brimmed [[black headwear|black]] [[hat]] and dresses in black clothes with [[long sleeves|long]], flared-out sleeves.

Addressed to as "Grandmother" (obaa-sama) by McQueen.

The Mejiro matriarch shares some resemblance with Kitano Miya, the real-life former owner and chairman of Mejiro Farm (Mejiro Shouji Co Ltd). Mrs. Kitano was also affectionately referred to as "Granny Mejiro" by Japanese horse racing fans.

As [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|]]'s grandmother is canonically known to have won the Tenno Sho before, the matriarch is widely speculated to be a [[horse girl]] and a composite representation of both Kitano Miya and Mejiro Asama (grandsire to the [[Mejiro McQueen (racehorse)|real-life Mejiro McQueen]] and also former winner of the Tenno Sho). An alternative interpretation holds that the matriarch is human (no horse ears visible and the telephone in her office is sized for humans) and the Tenno Sho winner to be McQueen's [i]other[/i] grandmother.

h4. Related characters

* [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|]]

h4. External links

* "JP Wikipedia: Kitano Miya":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%8C%97%E9%87%8E%E3%83%9F%E3%83%A4]
* "Japanese Bloodstock Information System: Mejiro Asama":[https://www.jbis.jp/horse/0000017015/]
* "Mitaiyomitai: Mejiro Grandmother (Umamusume)! Introducing the person and the horse she is based and modeled on":[https://mitaiyomitai.com/anime/post-28295/]
other_names: メジロ家のおばあさま

title: hinode_makibaoo
body:
Main character of [[Taiyou no Makibaoo]] and nephew of previous protagonist [[Midori Makibaoo]]. Also known as Bunta (his birth name).

Is a [[horse]]. Like [[Midori Makibaoo]], Bunta resembles a small white mule with large nostrils, though he has a prominent cowlick in front and does not (usually) have dripping nostrils.

Bunta is based on the real-life racehorse [[Haru Urara (racehorse)|]]. Or rather, the life story of Haru Urara, as Bunta himself does not resemble Haru Urara in appearance and is male instead of female.

h4. Related characters

title: omaha_beach
body:
One of five beach landing sectors designated for the amphibious assault component of [[D-Day]] during [[World War II]], falling under the responsibility of primarily the [[United States Army]].

Due to the geographical features of the beach that favors the defenders, such as its steep bluffs and narrow exits, the fierce Axis resistance, and the pre-landing bombardment failing to soften the defenses, it was most difficult beach to capture, with the Allies suffering the most casualties out of the five sectors.

Appears as a short, [[old man|elderly man]] wearing sunglasses and a hat. Usually holds a [[walking cane|walking staff]].

Musaka is a veteran umamusume trainer who later came out of retirement to become [[Oguri Cap (umamusume)|]]'s [[trainer (umamusume)|]] after Oguri is transferred into the main branch of Tracen Academy.

Nicknamed "Roppei" (alternate reading of his surname) by both his nephew and Oguri.

body:

title: yaeno_muteki's_trainer
body:
Unnamed supporting character from [[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]]. [[Yaeno Muteki (umamusume)|]]'s [[trainer (umamusume)|]] from the Cinderella Gray manga continuity.

Appears as a tall, [[long hair|long-haired]], imposing [[old man]] with [[mustache]] and [[beard]]. His overall appearance resembles an aged martial arts master, with some similarities to fan portrayals of [[Konpaku Youki]].

Long-time acquaintance of [[Musaka Ginjirou]] and [[Komiyama Masami]]. Also drinking buddies with Musaka.

h4. Related characters

* [[Yaeno Muteki (umamusume)|]]
other_names: ヤエノムテキのトレーナー

title: trainer_kuronuma
body:
[[Mihono Bourbon (umamusume)|]]'s [[trainer (umamusume)|]] from Season 2 of the [[Umamusume]] anime.

Appears as a man dressed in 'gangsta rapper' clothes, with sunglasses and hat and an [[open jacket]] baring his chest. Also has short hair and a [[goatee]] and wears a [[necklace]]. Only his surname is given, as "Kuronuma".

Voiced by [[Kuroda Takaya]] of [[Kiryu Kazuma]] fame. In fact Kuronuma is a [i]dead ringer[/i] for his voice actor, down to having the exact same hairstyle and facial hair. His voice actor is also known to wear the exact same clothes (except with an additional shirt underneath covering his chest) and accessories.

Because of this, Kuronuma is often drawn in fanart channeling the mannerisms of [[Kiryu Kazuma]] as a [[voice actor connection]]. These examples are often tagged "The Dragon of Tracen" (トレセンの龍) on Japanese websites, as a play on Kazuma's nickname.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6595617

h4. Related characters

* [[Mihono Bourbon (umamusume)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Kuroda Takaya]]
* [[Kiryu Kazuma]]

title: nase_fumino
body:
Supporting character from [[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]]. [[Super Creek (umamusume)|]]'s [[trainer (umamusume)|]] from the Cinderella Gray manga continuity.

She is a young woman with [[short hair|short]] to [[medium hair|medium]] hair with prominent [[swept bangs]] nearly covering her left eye.

She is a bokkuko (a girl who uses the masculine pronoun "boku" to refer to herself). 

Speculated by fans to be a [[genderswap]]ped alternate universe version of famed Japanese jockey (and Umamusume commercial regular) [[Take Yutaka]] because of their similar backgrounds (both Yutaka and Fumino having well-known fathers in the same business). Like Yutaka in real life, Nase Fumino also insists on having Super Creek assigned to her.  Shifting "Na" and "se" each one column up in the Japanese syllabary also yields "Take". 

h4. Appearance

* !post #9805270

h4. Related characters

* [[Super Creek (umamusume)|]]
* [[Nase Hidehito]] - Fumino's father

title: seeking_the_pearl_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. A [[horse girl]] who doesn't just want to be a small speck in history. Having lived in many different countries growing up, she wants to show that with her body, anything in the world can happen. And she can prove it, delivering great results in short and mile races with a smile on her face.

She is also considered a big sister figure among younger [[horse girl]]s because of her life. However, despite all her traveling, she actually doesn't speak English. She mitigates this comfortably by using body language.

title: nishino_flower_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

The obligatory gifted [[child]] character. She is the shortest character overall at 135cm, but this is justified by being an actual child. She is often paired with [[Hishi Akebono_(umamusume)|]], the tallest and largest horse girl of Tracen (at 180 cm tall), simply for the [[height difference]]. She is also often paired with [[Seiun Sky_(umamusume)|]] due to their real-life relationship (same owner and one of the few opportunities for Seiun Sky to actually mate as an unpopular stud).

title: clumsy
body:
A character making a mistake due to their clumsiness, lack of attention, etc. A good example is when a character gets tangled up in their legs and falls. Anime girls who are known for being bungling, clumsy, klutzy, or blunder-prone are referred to as dojikko.

It's not the same as [[you're doing it wrong]], where normally the error happens due to the character's lack of knowledge rather than their clumsiness.

h4. Examples

* !post #7351943

h4. See also

* [[fallen down]]
* [[tripping]]
* [[slipping]]
* [[falling]]

title: meisho_doto_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

The local [[large breasts|large breasted]] [[clumsy|klutz]]. She has [[purple eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[two-tone_hair|two-tone]] [[brown_hair|brown]] and  [[pink hair|light pink hair]] (although it's often depicted as [[white hair|white]]) with [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair_between_eyes|between her eyes]] and an [[ahoge]]. She wears an [[ear ribbon]] on her right ear, she's often depicted with [[@_@]] eyes.

Her self-deprecation attitude matches [[Rice Shower (Umamusume)|]]'s (the big difference is that Doto has a lot of friends despite always losing while Rice, due to her reputation, has only a few loyal friends). Also she is a fan of [[T.M. Opera O (Umamusume)|]], whom she idolizes.

h4. Appearance

title: ei_ei_mun!
body:
[[Catchphrase]] of [[Umamusume]]'s [[Matikanetannhauser (umamusume)|]]. Usually said with both [[clenched hands|fists clenched]] like the [[ganbaru pose]] but with arms spread further apart.

This phrase is memetic enough to overflow to the real-life [[Matikanetannhauser (Racehorse)|]], with tweets of images of said horse being flooded with "Ei, ei, mun!" comments. Even NHK's official Twitter account has taken part in this.

h4. Examples

* !post #9646998

h4. See also

* [[Matikanetannhauser (umamusume)|]]
* [[ganbaru pose]]
* [[Ganbaruzoi]]

title: god_gundam
body:
[b]GF13-017NJII God Gundam[/b]
[[Domon_Kasshu|Domon Kasshu]]'s second [[Gundam]], which he used after [[shining_gundam|Shining Gundam]]. Its signature moves are "[[Bakunetsu God Finger]]" and "[[Sekiha Tenkyoken]]".

In the English dub, the Gundam is known as [b]Burning Gundam[/b], likely to avoid using the taboo word "God". Following suit, the siganture move became "Erupting Burning Finger".

title: list_of_tagged_songs
body:
h4. List of tagged songs

This is a list of songs currently tagged here. This includes fanart of costumes used in a song and/or parodies of it.
(This is a wiki work-in-progress; feel free to contribute, keeping in mind the alphabetical order and appropriate group of tags.)

[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "DeeMo":#dtext-deemo

title: nether_gundam
body: The one Gundam from G Gundam that looks like a windmill, which is its disguise and helped it make it to the final tournament. Unfortunately its actual performance was rather lackluster and it was eliminated early on.

title: nobel_gundam
body:
[b]GF13-050NSW Nobel Gundam[/b]
The mobile fighter of Neo Sweden in [[G Gundam]], piloted by [[Allenby Beardsley]]. Notable for it's feminine appearance, highlighted by it's [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and serafuku-inspired design, leading to many comparisons to [[Sailor Moon]]. The unit is equipped with a Berserker System, which increases it's output while sending the pilot into an uncontrollable rage. It was renamed to [b]Noble Gundam[/b] in the English dub.

In both the original TV series and many of it's [[Super Robot Wars]] and [[SD Gundam G-Generation]] appearances, it's been capable of performing a [[Bakunetsu God Finger]]. In the manga adaptation, it is succeeded by the [[Super Nobel Gundam]] for the final battle.

title: tequila_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] universe.

The [b]GF13-049NM Tequila Gundam[/b] is a [[mobile_suit|mobile fighter]] that appears in the TV anime [b][i]Mobile Fighter [[G Gundam]][/i][/b].

It is piloted by [[Chico Rodriguez]] from Neo [[Mexico]] and is named after [[tequila|the popular Mexican beverage of the same name]]. It is an amphibious-type specially designed for underwater combat. While its defensive capabilities are relatively poor, the Tequila Gundam can block attacks with the reinforced armor on its shoulders and forearms. it is capable of launching the spikes on its right shoulder armor like [[missile]]s, and can also detach and propel its hat at opponents.

The "[[hat]]" structure is armed with several Vulcan guns capable of firing in all directions. It is also armed with a [[beam trident]] and a special weapon called the "[[Tequila]] Vortex" mounted atop of the hat structure: The [[sombrero]]-like structure houses a rotating fan, which allows the Tequila Gundam to create a powerful [[whirlpool]] and pull enemy mobile fighters into the water.

title: devil_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[G Gundam]].

[b]JDG-00X Devil Gundam[/b]

A monstrously powerful [[mobile_suit|Mobile Fighter]] created by Dr. Kasshu, father of [[Domon Kasshu]]. While originally built as the [b]Ultimate Gundam[/b] and intended to help clean the polluted Earth, a malfunction caused by its rough landing made its AI turn evil, and it became the Devil Gundam.

title: chinese_gundam
body:
In December 2010, a Chinese theme park decided to build their own "giant statue":http://www.sankakucomplex.com/2010/12/09/giant-gundam-china-style/ of Gundam RX-78 - unlicensed. It seems like Bandai took some measures and the statue disappeared - only to reappear later "remodeled":http://www.sankakucomplex.com/2011/01/30/chinese-gundam-returns/.

title: yumene_connect
body:
Yumene Connect (Japanese: ゆめねこねくと, Hepburn: Yumene Konekuto) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Sawada Kou]]. It began serialization in Kodansha's Weekly Shōnen Magazine in September 2024, and has been compiled into five volumes as of September 2025.

The series follows Takamiya Yuuhi, a first-year high school student and a loner. Having missed his entire first week of school due to a sudden illness, he becomes conscious of the fact that he has been unable to make any friends. Suddenly, an alien named [[Nano (Yumene Connect)|]] arrives after hearing his plight and aims to help him. However, this only leads to lewd hijinks affecting him and those around him. Nano, together with an alien lifeform named [[Nyoru Puppu Panpippi]], comes to live with Yuuhi.

h4. Characters

* [[Nano (Yumene Connect)|]]

title: assault_lily
body:
A mixed-media franchise that began in 2013 as a series of 1/12 scale action figures from Azone International. The figures are based on Azone's Picco Neemo doll line and thus compatible with the 1/12 fabric clothes produced by them and 3rd parties.

Artists that have done character key illustrations for the franchise include [[Yaegashi Nan]], [[Nauribon]] and [[hotaru (ultraroly poly)|Hotaru]].

The background story is set in the near future, where mankind is under threat by mysterious giant monsters called Huge that can only be fought by Lilies—girls who can use weapons called CHARMs to channel the power of Magie. Lilies fight in teams of five or more known as "Legions," and attend academies known as "Gardens" which train and command them.

Other parts of the media mix include ongoing stage plays since 2016; several light novels and webnovels; two anime series, [i]Assault Lily: Bouquet[/i] and [i]Assault Lily: Fruits[/i]; and a social game for phones and PCs, [i]Assault Lily: Last Bullet[/i], that began service in early 2021.

title: q_(james_bond)
body:
A [[james bond (series)|James Bond]] character. As the Quartermaster (hence his code name), he is responsible for the weapons and gadgets that [[James Bond]] uses in his missions. 

While originally played by Peter Burton in 1962's [[Dr. No]], he was later played by Desmond Llewelyn starting [[From Russia with Love]] and has been the longest running character in the series to be portrayed by the same actor (along with Lois Maxwell who played as Miss Moneypenny) before Desmond's death in 1999 where [[John Cleese]] took over as the new Q.

In the new [[Daniel Craig]] James Bond movies, Q is played by Ben Whishaw where unlike the previous Qs who were older men, is much younger than Bond.

title: bodystocking
body:
A bodystocking is similar to a [[bodysuit]], but usually made of sheer material or soft fabric, while a normal bodysuit is thicker and more rigid. Think of it as a full-body [[pantyhose]], and/or a hybrid of pantyhose and bodysuit.

[[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]], [[Ganyu (Genshin Impact)|]] and [[Isolated Island Oni]] are examples of characters who wear bodystockings.

h4. Examples

* !post #2620371: [[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]]
* !post #4296018: [[Ganyu (Genshin Impact)|]]
* !post #1680857: [[Isolated Island Oni]]

h4. See also

* [[lingerie]]
* [[unitard]]

title: sylph
body:
A [b]slyph[/b] or sylphid is a spirit of the air, often depicted as a feminine air elemental or a type of [[fairy]].

title: salamander
body:
A common name for amphibians of the order Urodela. They are typically characterized by their slender bodies, short noses, and long tails.

In legend, they were associated with fire and several ancient writers believed they were born from fire or could consume or otherwise extinguish it with the cold(-blooded) bodies. Many fantastic works use them as a kind of fire elemental.

h6. Specific real-world salamanders

* [[Axolotl]]
* [[Giant salamander]]
* [[Hellbender]]

h6. Specific fantasy salamanders

* [[Salamander (Mon-Musu Quest!)]]
* [[Salamander (Monster Girl Encyclopedia)]]
* [[Salamander (Seiken Densetsu)]]
* [[Tiaplate]] ([[ishuzoku_reviewers]])

h4. See also

* [[Lizard]], which salamanders are often confused with
* [[Gnome]], often serving as an earth elemental equivalent
* [[Sylph]], often serving as an air elemental equivalent
* [[Undine]], often serving as a water elemental equivalent

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Salamanders in folklore":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salamanders_in_folklore]

title: undine
body:
An [[undine]] is a spirit of water. Originating as a type of nymph in Greek mythology, it was classified by Paracelsus as the water [[elemental_(creature)|elemental]].

title: strapless_one-piece_swimsuit
body: A [[one-piece swimsuit]] that has no shoulder straps, [[halterneck]]s, or attached sleeves, instead relying on the tightness of the swimsuit fabric to keep it in place, making it resemble a [[strapless leotard]].
